Traveling%20Under%20Sail%20with%20the%20Historic%20Sea%20Cloud%20Fleet https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/traveling-under-sail-with-the-historic-sea-cloud-fleet/large_rgb-lindblad-expeditions-ship-sea-cloud-exterior-sc061.jpg Guests%20enjoy%20the%20Lido%20deck%20lounge%20on%20the%20ship%20Sea%20Cloud. %3Cp%3EWhen%20Marjorie%20Merriweather%20Post%20designed%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%3C/em%3E,%20she%20achieved%20the%20perfect%20balance%20of%20opulence%20and%20comfort,%20creating%20a%20space%20where%20her%20affluent%20friends%20could%20unwind%20under%20sail,%20enjoy%20al%20fresco%20meals,%20and%20anchor%20at%20sea%20for%20an%20impromptu%20dip.%20That%20relaxed,%20yet%20elegant%20atmosphere%20continues%20to%20this%20day%20and%20has%20been%20seamlessly%20adopted%20by%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%20II%3C/em%3E.%20Every%20aspect%20of%20your%20experience%20is%20laid-back%20and%20conducive%20to%20casual%20dress,%20including%20special%20events,%20like%20the%20fresh%20tuna%20dinner%20in%20the%20ship’s%20sumptuous%20dining%20room.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20David%20Vargas%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/traveling-under-sail-with-the-historic-sea-cloud-fleet/large_rgb-lindblad-expeditions-ship-sea-cloud-ii-interior-00046.jpg Two%20chefs%20filet%20a%20fish%20in%20the%20galley%20on%20the%20Sea%20Cloud%20II %3Cp%3EThe%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%3C/em%3E%20fleet%20is%20known%20for%20its%20outstanding%20cuisine,%20crafted%20by%20chefs%20who%20have%20trained%20at%20some%20of%20the%20world’s%20top%20restaurants.%20Fresh,%20locally%20sourced%20ingredients%20are%20featured%20prominently%20at%20every%20meal,%20including%20fish%20and%20seafood%20sustainably%20caught%20from%20the%20surrounding%20waters.%20For%20breakfast%20and%20lunch,%20guests%20can%20help%20themselves%20to%20a%20buffet%20of%20fresh%20fruits,%20breads,%20and%20salads%20as%20well%20as%20an%20array%20of%20hot%20dishes.%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%3C/em%3E%20and%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%20II%3C/em%3E%20also%20carry%20curated%20selections%20of%20complimentary%20beer,%20wine,%20liquors,%20and%20liqueurs%20that%20guests%20can%20enjoy%20throughout%20their%20journey.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Courtesy%20of%20Sea%20Cloud%20Cruises%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/traveling-under-sail-with-the-historic-sea-cloud-fleet/large_rgb-lindblad-expeditions-ship_seacloud_exterior_sc059.jpg A%20guest%20receives%20photography%20tips%20from%20a%20certified%20photo%20instructor%20on%20the%20ship%20Sea%20Cloud %3Cp%3EGuests%20traveling%20aboard%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%3C/em%3E%20and%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%20II%3C/em%3E%20enjoy%20the%20immersive%20programming%20that%20is%20the%20hallmark%20of%20a%20Lindblad%20Expeditions-National%20Geographic%20voyage.%20Delve%20into%20your%20destination’s%20natural%20landscape%20and%20cultural%20history%20during%20talks%20from%20our%20experts,%20capture%20the%20beauty%20of%20your%20journey%20with%20the%20help%20of%20a%20certified%20photo%20instructor,%20and%20enjoy%20evening%20recaps%20that%20highlight%20your%20group’s%20discoveries%20and%20set%20the%20stage%20for%20the%20next%20day’s%20adventures.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20David%20Vargas%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/traveling-under-sail-with-the-historic-sea-cloud-fleet/large_rgb-lindblad-expeditions-ship-sea-cloud-ii-exterior-00013.jpg Sailing%20crew%20working%20on%20the%20ship%20Sea%20Cloud%20II %3Cp%3EWhether%20you%20are%20beginning%20your%20journey%20or%20have%20seen%20the%20process%20before,%20it%20is%20always%20thrilling%20to%20witness%20acrobatic%20sailors%20climb%20the%20rigging,%20loosen%20the%20heavy%20cloth,%20and%20haul%20the%20lines%20in%20from%20the%20deck—performing%20a%20grand%20choreography%20that%20never%20ceases%20to%20mesmerize.%20The%20genuine%20camaraderie%20between%20captain%20and%20crew%20allows%20them%20to%20work%20in%20concert.%20Many%20of%20the%20sailors%20have%20been%20with%20the%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%3C/em%3E%20fleet%20for%20decades%20and%20for%20them,%20the%20square-rigger%20is%20home.%20They%20are %20eager%20to%20show%20you%20an%20in-depth%20look%20at%20the%20art%20of%20their%20daily%20work%20and%20the%20turn-of-the-century%20navigation%20system.%20While%20at%20sea,%20the%20ship%20engines%20are%20sparsely%20used,%20allowing%20you%20to%20settle%20into%20a%20deck%20chair%20and%20become%20immersed%20in%20a%20tranquil%20sailing%20experience.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Kerstin%20Tarach%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/traveling-under-sail-with-the-historic-sea-cloud-fleet/lindblad-expeditions-ship-sea-cloud-ii-cabin-cat-6-00002.jpg %3Cp%3EThe%20cabins%20aboard%20the%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%3C/em%3E%20fleet%20harken%20back%20to%20a%20bygone%20era%20of%20sheer%20opulence—antique%20furnishings,%20marble%20fireplaces,%20gold%20fixtures%20and%20exquisite%20accouterments%20that%20are%20a%20testament%20to%20the%20power%20couple%20who%20spared%20no%20expense%20in%20designing%20each%20room.%20Aboard%20the%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%3C/em%3E,%2030%20outside-facing%20cabins%20are%20uniquely%20and%20regally%20decorated—each%20aspect%20hand-picked%20by%20Merriweather%20Post.%20The%20ship%20also%20features%20the%20two%20lavish%20owners’%20suites:%20a%20rich,%20wood%20paneled%20sanctuary%20that%20belonged%20to%20her%20financier%20husband,%20E.F.%20Hutton,%20and%20the%20heiress’%20all-white,%20Louis%20XVI%20style%20room.%20The%2044%20outward-facing%20cabins%20aboard%20%3Cem%3ESea%20Cloud%20II%3C/em%3E%20stay%20true%20to%20its%20counterpart%20with%20mahogany%20and%20marble%20finishes%20while%20incorporating%20modernized%20amenities%20like%20flat-screen%20televisions.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Dirk%20Weyer-Fotografie%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3EIn%20the%20heart%20of%20Zululand%20north%20of%20Durban,%20this%20Big%20Five%20park%20is%20known%20for%20saving%20the%20white%20rhino%20from%20extinction.%20Breeding%20efforts%20were%20so%20successful%20that%20the%20reserve%20now%20has%20one%20of%20the%20world’s%20largest%20populations%20of%20white%20rhinos%20as%20well%20as%20hundreds%20of%20black%20rhinos.%20This%2024,000-acre%20expanse%20of%20rolling%20hills%20and%20savannah%20is%20the%20oldest%20game%20reserve%20in%20Africa,%20established%20in%201895.%20On%20a%20game-viewing%20drive%20in%20an%20open%20four-wheel-drive%20safari%20vehicle,%20it%20is%20possible%20to%20encounter%20a%20notably%20large%20population%20of%20nyala%20(a%20spiral-horned%20antelope)%20as%20well%20as%20healthy%20numbers%20of%20giraffes,%20cheetah,%20wild%20dog,%20blue%20wildebeest,%20warthog,%20and%20impala.%20Among%20hundreds%20of%20species%20of%20birds,%20look%20for%20barbets,%20cuckoos,%20and%20francolins,%20and%20Hluhluwe-iMfolozi%20is%20also%20a%20rare%20location%20to%20see%20three%20longclaw%20species.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E A%20long%20long%20streak%20of%20ocean,%20darkened%20by%20the%20reef%20underneath %3Cp%3EThe%20tides%20of%20Montgomery%20Reef%20recede%20so%20fully%20and%20rapidly%20that%20as%20the%20water%20rushes%20away,%20the%20coral%20reef%20and%20its%20inhabitants%20emerge%20like%20magic%20from%20the%20Indian%20Ocean.%20When%20one%20of%20the%20world’s%20largest%20inshore%20reefs%20is%20exposed,%20deeper-dwelling%20marine%20life%20surfaces%20and%20birds%20swoop%20in%20to%20feast.%20As%20we%20navigate%20channels%20through%20the%20reef%20in%20our%20Zodiacs,%20we%20will%20witness%20this%20rare%20phenomenon%20of%20an%20undersea%20world%20merging%20with%20a%20terrestrial%20one,%20surrounded%20by%20cormorants%20and%20egrets,%20sea%20turtles,%20and%20reef%20sharks.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3ESix%20species%20of%20sea%20turtles,%20dolphins,%20manatee-like%20dugongs,%20and%20crocodiles%20inhabit%20the%20115-square-mile%20reef%20where%20tides%20can%20measure%2033%20feet.%20It’s%20part%20of%20the%20Lalang-garram/Camden%20Sound%20Marine%20Park,%20a%20critical%20humpback%20whale%20nursery%20that’s%20a%20feeding%20ground%20for%20an%20estimated%2020,000%20whales%20that%20annually%20migrate%20from%20Antarctica.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-you-didnt-know-about-australias-kimberley-region/shutterstock_1453973081.jpg Two%20land%20masses%20almost%20touching%20above%20water,%20letting%20a%20stream%20of%20azure%20sea%20flow%20into%20a%20small%20blue-green%20bay %3Cp%3EAs%20the%2033-foot%20seawater%20tide%20rushes%20through%20two%20narrow%20gorges%20of%20the%20McLarty%20Range%20and%20into%20the%20turquoise%20water%20of%20Talbot%20Bay,%20a%20forceful%20horizontal%20stream%20of%20water%20produces%20waterfall%20rapids.%20Tide%20peak%20flow%20can%20reach%2015%20knots%20at%20the%20aptly%20named%20Horizontal%20Falls,%20which%20squeeze%20through%20rocky%20openings%20that%20are%20respectively%2039%20and%2067%20feet.%20The%20incredible%20power%20of%20enormous%20volumes%20of%20water%20traveling%20quickly%20through%20an%20enclosed%20area%20rotates%20the%20flow%20and%20creates%20currents,%20rapids,%20and%20whirlpools%20that%20in%20certain%20conditions%20are%20possible%20to%20navigate.%20It's%20an%20expedition%20highlight%20that,%20like%20most%20of%20the%20Kimberley,%20is%20not%20easily%20accessed.%20In%20the%201,000-island%20Buccaneer%20Archipelago,%20Horizontal%20Falls%20is%20so%20remote%20that%20any%20type%20of%20approach%20by%20road%20is%20impossible.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EAdding%20to%20the%20aquatic%20phenomenon,%20not%20only%20does%20the%20tide%20rush%20from%20the%20ocean%20to%20the%20bay,%20but%20it%20also%20reverses.%20Every%20day%20when%20the%20tide%20turns,%20the%20flow%20changes%20direction.%3C/p%3E A%20range%20of%20reddish%20brown%20mountains%20or%20hills,%20curiously%20shaped%20and%20streaked%20with%20horizontal%20ridges %3Cp%3EUnusual%20orange-and-black%20striped%20sandstone%20formations%20stretch%20across%20nearly%20600,000%20acres%20of%20the%20Kimberley,%20creating%20a%20stunningly%20unique%20and%20geologically%20exceptional%20landscape.%20Resembling%20giant%20beehives,%20the%20Bungle%20Bungle%20Range%20is%20a%20maze%20of%20conical%20towers%20sculpted%20by%20wind%20and%20sand%20into%20varying%20heights,%20with%20the%20tallest%20soaring%20nearly%201,000%20feet%20upwards%20to%20the%20blue%20desert%20sky.%20Winding%20gorges%20and%20narrow%20chasms%20intersect%20the%20cone%20karsts,%20which%20are%20further%20enhanced%20by%20fan%20palms%20and%20seasonal%20waterfalls.%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EAlthough%20the%20Bungle%20Bungle%20Range%20is%20350%20million%20years%20old,%20the%20world%20didn't%20learn%20of%20this%20otherworldly%20landscape%20until%20a%20documentary%20about%20it%20aired%20in%20the%201980s.%20Soon%20after,%20it%20was%20protected%20as%20part%20of%20Purnululu%20National%20Park,%20and%20then%20became%20a%20World%20Heritage%20site.%20In%20their%20inscription,%20UNESCO%20describes%20the%20Bungles%20as%20“unrivalled%20in%20their%20scale,%20extent,%20grandeur,%20and%20diversity%20of%20form%20anywhere%20in%20the%20world.”%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EIndividual%20instances%20of%20cave%20art%20in%20other%20parts%20of%20the%20world%20are%20better%20known,%20so%20it%20might%20surprise%20people%20to%20learn%20that%20in%20Australia,%20there%20are%20more%20than%20100,000%20ancient%20paintings%20in%20the%20Kimberley%20wilderness%20alone.%20Created%20an%20estimated%2040,000%20years%20ago,%20they%20can%20be%20found%20in%20caves%20and%20on%20escarpments%20over%20an%20area%20of%2012%20million%20acres.%20Arriving%20by%20Zodiac%20in%20Vansittart%20Bay,%20we%20can%20access%20some%20of%20these%20moving%20coastal%20paintings%20in%20what%20is%20known%20as%20a%20bush%20gallery.%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EDiscovered%20by%20Europeans%20in%201891,%20these%20cave%20artworks,%20known%20as%20Gwion%20Gwion%20Aboriginal%20art%20differ%20in%20style%20from%20Aboriginal%20art%20found%20in%20other%20parts%20of%20the%20country.%20Humans%20appear%20stretched,%20wear%20clothing,%20and%20are%20adorned%20with%20tassels%20and%20hair%20ornaments.%20Holding%20outstanding%20cultural%20significance,%20this%20rock%20art%20is%20a%20profound%20record%20of%20Australia's—and%20the%20world’s—earliest%20human%20history.%3C/p%3E A%20river%20gorge%20made%20up%20of%20a%20natural%20formation%20of%20flat%20stone,%20intricately%20layered.%20 %3Cp%3EAustralia%20is%20the%20Earth’s%20oldest%20continent,%20with%20a%20continental%20crust%20that%20was%20formed%204.4%20billion%20years%20ago—around%20the%20time%20the%20moon%20came%20into%20existence.%20A%20land%20this%20primeval%20is%20extremely%20compelling%20not%20only%20to%20geologists%20but%20also%20to%20scientists%20who%20study%20fossils%20and%20early%20life%20forms.%20Recent%20discoveries%20in%20Western%20Australia%20confirmed%20the%20existence%20of%20significant%20amounts%20of%20both%20live%20and%20fossilized%20stromatolites,%20which%20are%20rare%20life%20forms%20that%20can%20be%20traced%20back%20to%20the%20beginning%20of%20life%20itself;%20they%20produced%20oxygen,%20making%20it%20possible%20for%20other%20life%20forms%20to%20develop%20and%20survive.%20This%20makes%20Western%20Australia%20a%20center%20for%20those%20who%20pursue%20a%20greater%20understanding%20of%20the%20origin%20and%20evolution%20of%20life.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/amazon-machu-pichu-sites/incan-ruins-at-machu-picchu.jpg A%20Closer%20Look:%207%20Must-See%20Sights%20at%20Machu%20Picchu https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/amazon-machu-pichu-sites/view-from-the-sun-gate-at-machu-picchu.jpg %3Cp%3EKnown%20as%20Inti%20Punku,%20this%20is%20how%20the%20Inca%20entered%20the%20site%20from%20Cusco,%20capital%20of%20the%20empire,%20and%20is%20still%20the%20entrance%20today%20for%20those%20who%20make%20the%20trek%20on%20the%20Inca%20Trail.%20Elevated%20an%20additional%20300%20meters%20above%20the%20main%20complex,%20its%20remote%20location%20suggests%20that%20entry%20to%20Machu%20Picchu%20was%20heavily%20guarded,%20and%20only%20those%20the%20emperor%20allowed%20in%20passed%20through%20this%20door%20dedicated%20to%20the%20worship%20of%20the%20Sun%20God%20or%20“Inti.”%20During%20the%20winter%20solstice,%20the%20door%20is%20illuminated%20by%20the%20sun,%20and%20it%20provides%20a%20wonderful%20view%20of%20the%20complex%20on%20any%20clear%20day.%20The%20moderately%20difficult%20hike%20to%20see%20the%20Sun%20Gate%20is%20well%20worth%20the%20effort,%20and%20visiting%20at%20sunrise%20is%20a%20popular%20choice.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/amazon-machu-pichu-sites/sacred-sun-dial-at-machu-picchu.jpg %3Cp%3EOne%20of%20many%20objects%20of%20both%20religious%20and%20astronomical%20significance%20located%20in%20the%20ritual%20area%20of%20the%20site,%20the%20Intihuatana%20(frequently%20translated%20as%20“hitching%20post%20of%20the%20sun”)%20points%20directly%20at%20the%20sun%20on%20the%20winter%20solstice,%20and%20was%20part%20of%20how%20the%20Incas%20tracked%20the%20passage%20of%20time%20and%20the%20dates%20of%20religious%20rituals.%20Large%20carved%20boulders%20like%20this%20one%20have%20been%20found%20throughout%20the%20Inca%20empire,%20and%20express%20a%20very%20real%20connection%20between%20supernatural%20forces%20and%20earthly%20events—anthropologists%20theorize%20this%20particular%20one%20was%20believed%20to%20hold%20the%20sun%20in%20its%20path%20across%20the%20sky%20as%20it%20reached%20its%20furthest%20point%20from%20the%20Earth%20during%20the%20winter%20solstice. %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/amazon-machu-pichu-sites/temple-of-the-sun-in-machu-picchu.jpg %3Cp%3EAlso%20called%20the%20Observatory,%20the%20unique%20semi-circular%20construction%20of%20this%20building%20makes%20it%20easy%20to%20spot%20at%20Machu%20Picchu.%20The%20curved%20granite%20blocks%20are%20beautifully%20finished%20in%20the%20Imperial%20style,%20sitting%20on%20top%20of%20a%20natural%20cave%20lined%20with%20masonry%20and%20possibly%20used%20as%20a%20mausoleum.%20It%20would%20have%20been%20an%20inspiring%20sight%20covered%20in%20its%20original%20gold%20embellishments,%20gleaming%20in%20the%20sun%20at%20the%20high%20point%20of%20the%20ritual%20section.%20The%20windows%20in%20the%20Observatory’s%20rounded%20walls%20indicate%20that%20they%20were%20used%20to%20calculate%20the%20June%20solstice,%20as%20well%20as%20the%20location%20of%20important%20constellations,%20while%20the%20central%20space%20and%20the%20cave%20below%20would%20have%20hosted%20several%20types%20of%20priestly%20rituals,%20making%20offerings%20to%20the%20sun%20as%20well%20as%20possibly%20acknowledging%20the%20underworld%20or%20the%20earth%20itself%20in%20the%20underground%20space. %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/amazon-machu-pichu-sites/stairway-of-the-fountains.jpg %3Cp%3EIt’s%20tempting%20to%20romanticize%20Machu%20Picchu%20as%20an%20exotic%20remnant%20of%20a%20bygone%20civilization,%20but%20in%20its%20own%20time,%20it%20served%20not%20just%20esoteric%20needs,%20but%20also%20the%20very%20practical%20urban%20concerns%20of%20housing%20hundreds%20of%20people%20within%20its%20limits%20that%20are%20perfectly%20relatable%20to%20anyone%20living%20today.%20Practicalities%20like%20terraced%20gardens%20(one%20of%20the%20oldest%20forms%20of%20farming%20known%20to%20humankind)%20fed%20hundreds%20of%20people,%20while%20the%20Stairway%20of%20the%20Fountains%20provided%20a%20steady%20stream%20of%20water%20throughout%20the%20complex.%20This%20cleverly%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.archaeology.org/issues/59-1301/76-sidebars/394-machu-picchu-inca-hydraulic-engineering%22%20target=%22_blank%22%20rel=%22noopener%20noreferrer%22%20data-auth=%22NotApplicable%22%20data-linkindex=%222%22%3Eengineered%20hydraulic%20system%3C/a%3E%20brought%20water%20from%20two%20springs%20a%20half-mile%20away%20through%20a%20system%20of%20channels%20to%2016%20public%20fountains%20(including%20one%20massive%20waterfall%20reserved%20for%20the%20emperor,%20Pachacuti%20Inka%20Yupanqui).%20Not%20only%20did%20it%20create%20a%20clean%20and%20reliable%20public%20water%20supply,%20the%20unique%20system%20ultimately%20helped%20protect%20the%20hillside%20from%20erosion,%20even%20during%20floods%20and%20rains. %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/amazon-machu-pichu-sites/watchmans-hut-at-machu-picchu.jpg %3Cp%3ELocated%20next%20to%20the%20cemetery%20and%20just%20a%20five-minute%20walk%20from%20the%20entrance%20to%20Machu%20Picchu,%20this%20perfect%20lookout%20point%20provides%20sweeping%20views%20of%20the%20agricultural%20section%20as%20well%20as%20the%20peaks%20beyond.%20It's%20a%20great%20way%20to%20get%20oriented%20as%20you%20begin%20your%20journey%20through%20the%20site.%20Just%20beside%20the%20Watchman’s%20Hut%20is%20the%20Funerary%20Rock,%20another%20large%20carved%20boulder%20with%20no%20known%20purpose.%20Theories%20about%20its%20use%20include%20mummification%20before%20funerary%20ceremonies,%20as%20well%20as%20animal%20sacrifices,%20but%20that%20doesn’t%20seem%20to%20bother%20the%20llamas%20that%20generally%20roam%20free%20in%20this%20area,%20grazing%20happily%20and%20posing%20for%20photos. %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/amazon-machu-pichu-sites/view-of-huyana-picchu.jpg %3Cp%3ELocated%202,400%20meters%20above%20sea%20level,%20the%20design%20of%20Machu%20Picchu%20thoughtfully%20weaves%20the%20stunning%20Andean%20landscape%20into%20design.%20One%20of%20the%20notable%20peaks%20directly%20behind%20the%20complex%20is%20Huayna%20Picchu,%20which%20means%20“Young%20Peak”%20in%20Quechua.%20Huayna%20Picchu%20provides%20some%20challenges,%20as%20it’s%20a%20steep%20hike%20with%20some%20sections%20that%20will%20require%20using%20your%20hands,%20as%20well%20as%20sections%20that%20include%20railings%20and%20cables%20for%20support,%20but%20anyone%20who%20is%20comfortable%20hiking%20at%20altitude%20and%20doesn’t%20fear%20heights%20should%20be%20able%20to%20reach%20the%201,000%20foot%20peak%20in%20about%20an%20hour.%20You’ll%20be%20well%20rewarded%20with%20a%20bird's-eye%20view%20of%20Machu%20Picchu’s%20architecture%20and%20a%20true%20sense%20of%20scale%20of%20the%20complex%20against%20its%20magnificent%20natural%20setting.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/amazon-machu-pichu-sites/temple-of-the-three-windows-machu-picchu.jpg %3Cp%3EOne%20of%20the%20best%20preserved%20and%20most%20impressive%20structures%20in%20the%20whole%20site,%20the%20Temple%20of%20the%20Three%20Windows%20is%20the%20first%20of%20three%20buildings%20that%20comprise,%20what%20Hiram%20Bingham%20described%20as,%20the%20“Sacred%20Plaza.”%20Archaeologists%20argue%20over%20the%20idea%20that%20the%20windows%20represent%20three%20aspects%20of%20the%20Inca%20world%20view—the%20underground%20(Uku-Pacha),%20the%20heavens%20(Hanan-Pacha),%20and%20the%20present%20time%20(Kay-Pacha).%20As%20you%20peer%20through%20them%20and%20take%20in%20the%20breathtaking%20views,%20you’ll%20likely%20be%20inspired%20to%20ponder%20these%20spiritual%20concepts%20too.%20While%20there%20you%20can%20also%20consider%20the%20sheer%20feats%20of%20engineering%20that%20occurred%20centuries%20ago—this%20temple%20is%20made%20up%20of%20much%20lar

%3Cp%3EThere’s%20something%20very%20serene%20about%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22/expedition-stories/stories/secrets-of-south-carolinas-salt-marsh%22%3Esalt%20marsh%3C/a%3E,%20where%20calm%20fresh%20and%20salt%20water%20comingle%20and%20snake%20through%20grasses%20and%20tidal%20creeks.%20South%20Carolina%20and%20Georgia%20have%20more%20of%20these%20coastal%20wetlands%20than%20any%20other%20region,%20and%20these%20rich%20intertidal%20habitats%20support%20oysters,%20fiddler%20crabs,%20terrapins,%20and%20occasionally%20even%20alligators%20and%20bottlenose%20dolphins.%20Salt%20marshes%20are%20best%20known%20for%20birds,%20though.%20Marsh%20wren%20and%20clapper%20rails%20nest%20here,%20but%20it’s%20the%20wading%20birds%20you%20are%20most%20likely%20to%20see,%20like%20wood%20storks%20and%20great%20blue%20herons,%20as%20well%20as%20shorebirds%20and%20seabirds%20like%20American%20oystercatchers,%20and%20brown%20pelicans,%20and%20songbirds%20like%20saltmarsh%20sparrow.%20Salt%20marshes%20also%20reduce%20erosion%20and%20efficiently%20absorb%20carbon,%20cementing%20their%20place%20in%20the%20pantheon%20of%20critical%20ecosystems.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-south-carolina--georgia/gulllah-geechee-handicrafts.jpg %3Cp%3EIf%20you’ve%20ever%20sung%20the%20campfire%20song%20“Kumbayah,”%20you’ve%20unwittingly%20spoken%20Gullah.%20The%20only%20distinctly%20African-American%20creole%20language%20in%20the%20United%20States,%20Gullah%20is%20today%20spoken%20by%20fewer%20than%205,000%20people%20in%20small%20South%20Carolina%20and%20Georgia%20coastal%20communities%20with%20wonderful%20names%20like%20Hog%20Hammock.%20Descendants%20of%20enslaved%20people%20mostly%20from%20West%20Africa,%20the%20Gullah%20developed%20their%20own%20tongue,%20building%20on%20words%20from%20English,%20Scots,%20and%20multiple%20African%20languages.%20In%20addition%20to%20the%20language,%20which%20has%20influenced%20Southern%20vocabulary%20and%20speech%20patterns,%20the%20isolation%20of%20these%20communities%20has%20also%20helped%20preserve%20a%20rich%20culture%20of%20storytelling,%20craftwork,%20and%20cuisine%20of%20African%20origin.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-south-carolina--georgia/boneyard-beach-south-carolina.jpeg %3Cp%3EMost%20of%20us%20have%20picked%20up%20small%20pieces%20of%20driftwood%20on%20a%20beach,%20but%20imagine%20entire%20driftwood%20trees%20covering%20a%20stretch%20of%20sand%20just%20like%20sculptures.%20Dramatic%20and%20ethereal,%20rare%20and%20otherworldly,%20driftwood%20forests%20occur%20as%20the%20sea%20claims%20maritime%20forests%20whose%20sand%20barriers%20give%20way%20to%20erosion.%20These%20%22boneyard%20beaches,%22%20as%20they%20are%20known,%20are%20adorned%20with%20the%20ever-changing%20twisted%20shapes%20of%20trees%20in%20different%20configurations.%20You%20might%20see%20one%20upright%20with%20its%20trunk%20feet%20deep%20in%20the%20ocean,%20a%20lone%20individual%20prone%20with%20its%20roots%20exposed,%20or%20a%20cluster%20of%20trees%20intertwined%20in%20intricate%20formations.%20With%20this%20unusual,%20wild%20landscape%20and%20the%20region's%20legendary%20sunsets,%20driftwood%20forests%20are%20a%20photographer’s%20dream.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-south-carolina--georgia/feral-horses-in-georgia.jpg %3Cp%3EOn%20Georgia’s%20Cumberland%20Island,%20horses%20meander%20on%20dirt%20roads%20lined%20with%20live%20oaks,%20graze%20in%20dune%20meadows,%20and%20gallop%20in%20the%20salt%20spray%20along%2017%20miles%20of%20undeveloped%20coastline.%20The%20only%20non-managed%20feral%20horses%20on%20the%20Atlantic%20coast,%20this%20herd%20of%20about%20150%20are%20descended%20from%20the%20Tennessee%20Walkers,%20Arabians,%20Paso%20Fino,%20and%20American%20Quarter%20Horses%20that%20were%20brought%20to%20the%20island%20over%20the%20centuries%20for%20transportation%20and%20field%20work;%20and%20later%20in%20the%20Carnegie%20era,%20for%20recreation%20like%20riding%20and%20hunting.%20Formerly%20domesticated,%20they%20now%20roam%20freely%20with%20no%20human%20intervention.%20Admire%20their%20wild%20beauty%20from%20a%20distance%20as%20they%20blend%20into%20the%20tapestry%20of%20this%20unique%20ecosystem.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-south-carolina--georgia/first-african-baptist-church-savannah.jpg %3Cp%3EPre-dating%20the%20United%20States%20itself,%20Savannah’s%20First%20African%20Baptist%20Church%20is%20a%20pioneering%20congregation.%20Organized%20in%201773%20and%20constituted%20in%201777,%20it%20is%20the%20oldest%20African%20American%20congregation%20in%20North%20America.%20In%20addition,%20it%20has%20ties%20to%20the%20Underground%20Railroad%20and%20its%20founding%20pastor%20became%20America’s%20first%20missionary%20when%20he%20migrated%20to%20Jamaica%20in%201782.%20The%20church’s%20third%20minister%20organized%20the%20first%20Black%20Sunday%20School%20in%20North%20America;%20and%20the%20first%20federal%20credit%20union%20housed%20in%20a%20church%20began%20providing%20savings%20and%20credit%20accounts%20here%20in%201954.%20It’s%20much%20more%20than%20a%20building,%20but%20its%20present%20edifice,%20which%20dates%20to%201859%20and%20is%20listed%20on%20the%20National%20Register,%20has%20many%20notable%20features.%20Keep%20an%20eye%20out%20for%20light%20fixtures%20that%20were%20originally%20gas;%20and%20in%20this%20church%20that%20was%20built%20by%20enslaved%20people,%20notice%20the%20BaKongo%20Cosmogram,%20comprised%20of%20West%20African%20prayer%20symbol%20pictograms,%20which%20is%20carved%20into%20the%20floor.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-galapagos/floreana-giant-tortoises-galapagos.jpg %3Cp%3EFrom%20lush%20and%20mountainous%20to%20barren%20and%20cacti-covered,%20each%20island%20offers%20something%20unique,%20and%20that%20often%20includes%20the%20wildlife.%20While%20the%20Galápagos%20boasts%20some%20of%20the%20highest%20endemism%20in%20the%20world,%20evolutionary%20changes%20on%20some%20islands%20have%20also%20created%20their%20own,%20exclusive%20sub-species.%20This%20uniqueness%20is%20what%20so%20puzzled%20Darwin%20and%20what%20will%20amaze%20you.%20The%20Volcán%20Alcedo%20giant%20tortoise%20and%20the%20San%20Cristobal%20mockingbird%20are%20two%20such%20examples,%20while%20the%20flightless%20cormorant%20can%20only%20be%20spotted%20on%20the%20islands%20of%20Isabela%20and%20Fernandina.%20Many%20islands%20also%20have%20their%20own%20plants.%20The%20largest%20species%20of%20prickly%20pear%20tree,%20for%20example,%20is%20found%20only%20on%20Santa%20Fe%20Island.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-galapagos/view-of-bartolome-island-galapagos.jpg %3Cp%3EBetween%20the%20late%201500s%20and%201700s,%20when%20the%20Spanish%20Empire%20extended%20deep%20into%20South%20America,%20pirates%20discovered%20that%20the%20Galápagos%20Islands%20were%20the%20perfect%20safe%20haven:%20strategically%20situated%20for%20raiding%20ships%20along%20the%20trade%20routes,%20but%20sufficiently%20distant%20to%20escape%20pursuers%20and%20store%20their%20plunder.%20Thanks%20to%20the%20abundant%20amount%20of%20%3Ca%20href=%22/expedition-stories/stories/wild-personalities-giant-tortoise%22%3Egiant%20tortoises%3C/a%3E,%20there%20was%20also%20a%20steady%20food%20source%20waiting%20for%20them.%20Pirates%20christened%20Galápagos,%20“the%20Enchanted%20Isles”%20after%20their%20seemingly%20magical%20ability%20to%20vanish%20in%20mists%20and%20spit%20fire%20from%20mountaintops.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-galapagos/darwin-the-origin-of-species.jpg %3Cp%3EThese%20are%20Darwin's%20islands,%20with%20Galápagos%20birds,%20shops,%20streets,%20landmarks,%20and%20a%20research%20station%20all%20bearing%20his%20name.%20Given%20his%20inextricable%20link%20with%20the%20islands,%20one%20often%20assumes%20the%20British%20naturalist%20spent%20years%20in%20the%20archipelago%20studying%20its%20iconic%20wildlife%20and%20venturing%20to%20a%20multitude%20of%20islands.%20In%20reality,%20he%20was%20here%20for%20just%20five%20weeks,%20during%20his%201835%20voyage%20aboard%20the%20%3Cem%3EHMS%20Beagle%3C/em%3E.%20And%20he%20never%20returned.%20Yet,%20Darwin's%20brief%20visit%20to%20just%20five%20islands

,%20was%20enough%20to%20inspire%20one%20of%20the%20most%20world-changing%20thoughts%20anyone%20has%20ever%20had.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-galapagos/galapagos-children-at-tomas-berlanga-school.jpg %3Cp%3EIf%20the%20fact%20that%20real%20Galapagueñas%20live%20and%20work%20in%20the%20islands%20hadn't%20crossed%20your%20mind,%20you're%20not%20alone.%20From%20magazine%20photographs%20to%20documentaries%20like%20%3Cem%3ELife%20on%20Earth%3C/em%3E,%20the%20focus%20when%20it%20comes%20to%20Galápagos%20has%20always%20been%20on%20the%20legendary%20wildlife%20and%20pristine%20landscapes.%20Yet,%2030,000%20humans%20live%20in%20this%20special%20archipelago,%20in%20specifically%20zoned%20areas%20spread%20across%20four%20inhabited%20islands.%20From%20shopkeepers%20and%20fishmongers%20in%20Puerto%20Ayora%20on%20Santa%20Cruz%20to%20the%20farmers%20in%20the%20Highlands%20who%20provide%20Lindblad-National%20Geographic%20ships%20with%20fresh%20produce,%20the%20locals%20rely%20on%20tourism,%20not%20only%20for%20their%20own%20livelihoods,%20but%20also%20to%20help%20support%20the%20conservation%20and%20protection%20of%20the%20islands%20for%20future%20generations%20to%20come. %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-galapagos/guests-watch-galapagos-volcano-from-the-ship.jpg %3Cp%3EBetween%205%20million%20years%20and%20less%20than%201%20million%20years%20ago,%20magma%20burst%20through%20the%20earth’s%20crust%20and%20spawned%20a%20mesmerizing%20cluster%20of%20islands%20of%20varying%20ages.%20As%20oceanic%20archipelagos%20go,%20the%20Galápagos%20is%20a%20geological%20youngster.%20Yet,%20it's%20one%20of%20the%20most%20seismically%20boisterous%20zones%20with%2013%20active%20volcanos%20producing%20regular%20eruptions.%20In%202018,%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ORZvEy5A768%22%3ESierra%20Negra%20volcano%20on%20Isabela%20Island%20erupted%3C/a%3E%20spectacularly%20and%20we%20rerouted%20our%20ships%20to%20ensure%20our%20guests%20got%20to%20experience%20the%20once-in-a-lifetime%20show.%20Now,%20all%20eyes%20are%20on%20Fernandina,%20an%20island%20volcano%20with%20dramatic%20subterranean%20turbulence%20recorded%20in%202020.%20Thankfully%20for%20us,%20these%20eruptions%20may%20be%20spectacular%20but%20they%20are%20gentle—effusive,%20rather%20than%20explosive!%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EA%20constant%20thirst%20for%20new%20adventures%20and%20a%20deep%20passion%20for%20exploring%20the%20world%20and%20sharing%20that%20passion%20with%20other%20people.%20I%20was%20working%20for%20Iceland%20Travel%20(the%20local%20tour%20operator%20for%20Lindblad-National%20Geographic)%20in%202014%20and%20got%20assigned%20to%20sail%20around%20Iceland%20for%20three%20weeks%20with%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22/about/fleet/national-geographic-explorer%22%3E%3Cem%3ENational%20Geographic%20Explorer%3C/em%3E%3C/a%3E%20as%20a%20local%20guide%20and%20to%20help%20with%20shore%20logistics.%20I%20had%20no%20idea%20about%20the%20world%20of%20expedition%20travel%20and%20living%20on%20board%20ships%20at%20the%20time,%20but%20this%20one%20assignment%20was%20enough%20to%20get%20me%20hooked%20and%20there%20was%20no%20turning%20back—I%20had%20to%20do%20more%20of%20that!%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto,%20polar%20plunge%20&%20main%20image:%20Andrew%20Peacock%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/meet-the-lex-staff/dagny-ivarsdottir/dagny-iceland-waterfalls.jpeg %3Cp%3EIceland!%20Of%20course,%20I%20am%20a%20little%20biased%20since%20I%20am%20from%20there%20but%20I%20also%20genuinely%20think%20%3Ca%20href=%22/itineraries/a-circumnavigation-of-iceland%22%3EIceland%3C/a%3E%20has%20something%20for%20everyone.%20It%20has%20breathtaking%20and%20versatile%20landscapes%20to%20actively%20explore%20or%20just%20take%20in%20from%20the%20ship;%20the%20geothermal%20hot%20springs%20are%20awesome;%20our%20flora%20and%20fauna%20is%20rich;%20the%20culinary%20experience%20is%20world%20class;%20there%20are%20so%20many%20artists%20and%20musicians;%20and%20the%20people%20and%20culture%20are%20both%20super%20charming.%20Whether%20you%20are%20a%20total%20city%20person%20or%20an%20outdoor%20enthusiast%20I%20think%20you%20will%20get%20the%20same%20satisfaction%20out%20of%20visiting.%20Icelanders%20are%20proud%20of%20their%20country%20for%20a%20good%20reason!%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/meet-the-lex-staff/dagny-ivarsdottir/polar-bear-east-greenland.jpeg %3Cp%3EProbably%20when%20I%20had%20my%20birthday%20on%20board%20the%20%3Cem%3ENational%20Geographic%20Explor%3C/em%3Eer%20in%20Arctic%20Svalbard.%20We%20had%20the%20most%20extraordinary%20day,%20spectacular%20ice,%20midnight%20sun,%20plus%20I%20saw%20my%20first%20polar%20bear%20and%20walrus.%20The%20team%20embarrassed%20me%20by%20having%20the%20whole%20ship%20sing%20%22Happy%20Birthday%22%20to%20me%20during%20evening%20Recap.%20And%20if%20I%20can%20add%20one%20more,%20it%20would%20be%20the%20time%20I%20did%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22/expedition-stories/stories/iceland-by-helicopter%22%3Eheli-hiking%20recon%20trip%20in%20Iceland%3C/a%3E%20with%20fellow%20naturalist%20Alizé%20Carrère%20where%20we%20flew%20helicopters%20and%20drove%20all%20over%20the%20country%20to%20find%20the%20best%20possible%20spots%20for%20our%20guests%20to%20have%20an%20amazing%20land%20extension.%3C/p%3E Guests%20exploring%20by%20zaodiac%20get%20amazing%20photos%20of%20a%20Leopard%20seal%20in%20Dallmann%20Bay,%20Antarctic%20Peninsula,%20Southern%20Ocean,%20Antarctica %3Cp%3EThe%20leopard%20seal%20may%20be%20the%20most%20famous%20of%20all%20the%20seals%20we%20see%20in%20the%20Antarctic,%20mostly%20due%20to%20their%20reputation%20as%20ferocious%20predators%20of%20penguins.%20They're%20also%20known%20for%20their%20rather%20sinister%20appearance%20which%20comes%20from%20their%20huge,%20bullet-shaped%20heads,%20long,%20sharp%20canine%20teeth,%20and%20mouths%20that%20can%20open%20wide%20enough%20to%20bite%20a%20basketball!%20It’s%20a%20thrilling%20sight%20to%20watch%20this%2010-foot-long,%20thousand-pound%20marine%20mammal%20snatching%20penguins%20out%20of%20the%20waves%20off%20the%20crowded%20breeding%20colonies,%20but%20you%20might%20be%20surprised%20to%20learn%20that%20their%20diet%20is%20actually%20about%2070%25%20krill%20and%20fish.%20Leopard%20seals%20are%20particularly%20fast%20and%20graceful%20in%20the%20water,%20and%20often%20very%20curious%20about%20boats,%20so%20we%20frequently%20get%20great%20looks%20at%20them%20twisting%20and%20spiraling%20through%20the%20water%20beneath%20our%20Zodiacs.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Ralph%20Lee%20Hopkins%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/6-seals-to-spot-in-the-southern-ocean/antarctica-aa319.jpg An%20adult%20Weddell%20seal%20hauled%20out%20and%20resting%20on%20ice%20on%20Petermann%20Island%20near%20the%20Antarctic%20Peninsula %3Cp%3EAs%20a%20biologist%20I’m%20a%20little%20reluctant%20to%20say%20this,%20but%20Weddell%20seals%20are%20probably%20the%20cutest%20of%20all%20the%20Antarctic%20seals%20with%20their%20big%20dark%20eyes,%20round%20heads,%20and%20short,%20whiskered%20snouts.%20But%20these%20seals%20aren't%20just%20a%20pretty%20face,%20they%20also%20have%20some%20amazing%20adaptations%20to%20support%20their%20challenging%20lives%20on%20the%20pack%20ice.%20They%20are%20skilled%20divers%20and%20can%20stay%20down%20for%20up%20to%20an%20hour%20and%20reach%20depths%20as%20great%20as%20720%20meters%20as%20they%20search%20for%20large%20fish%20such%20as%20Antarctic%20cod.%20They%20are%20always%20amusing%20to%20watch%20and%20capture%20everyone's%20hearts%20as%20we%20spot%20them%20popping%20their%20heads%20above%20the%20water%20or%20relaxing%20on%20ice%20close%20to%20the%20shore%20where%20they%20are%20safe%20from%20the%20killer%20whales%20that%20prey%20on%20them.%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Michael%20S.%20Nolan%3C/em%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E Curious%20Crabeater%20Seals%20on%20the%20pack%20ice%20in%20the%20Bellingshausen%20Sea,%20Antarctica %3Cp%3EThere%20are%20no%20crabs%20at%20all%20in%20the%20Southern%20Ocean%20around%20Antarctica,%20so%20the%20obvious%20question%20is:%20What%20do%20crabeater%20seals%20eat?%20The%20answer%20is%20krill,%20and%20they%20do%20it%20in%20an%20amazing%20way.%20Crabeater%20seals%20have%20very%20special%20teeth%20with%20several%20thin,%20blunt%20projections,%20like%20curling%20fingers.%20When%20the%20seal%20closes%20its%20jaws,%20these%20lobes%20from%20the%20top%20teeth%20interlock%20with%20those%20in%20the%20lower%20jaw%20and%20work%20like%20a%20sieve,%20allowing%20the%20seal%20to%20expel%20sea%20water%20and%20retain%20its%20mouthful%20of%20krill,%20just%20like%20the%20baleen%20of%20the%20great%20whales.%20

“Crabbies,”%20as%20we%20like%20to%20call%20them,%20have%20beautiful%20silvery%20coats%20and%20are%20the%20most%20numerous%20seal%20in%20the%20world—there%20may%20be%20as%20many%20as%20twenty%20million%20of%20them%20around%20the%20White%20Continent.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Ralph%20Lee%20Hopkins%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E Antarctic%20Fur%20Seal%20pups%20playing%20at%20Stromness%20Whaling%20Station%20on%20the%20island%20of%20South%20Georgia,%20southern%20Atlantic%20Ocean. %3Cp%3EFur%20seals%20are%20the%20odd%20one%20out%20in%20this%20group—they%20actually%20belong%20to%20a%20different%20family%20called%20the%20‘eared%20seals’.%20Unlike%20the%20'true%20seals'%20(all%20the%20others%20mentioned%20here),%20eared%20seals%20can%20walk%20on%20shore%20using%20all%20four%20of%20their%20flippers,%20and%20large%20forelimbs%20make%20them%20particularly%20fast,%20powerful%20swimmers.%20The%20females%20of%20this%20species%20are%20quite%20small,%20weighing%20only%20about%2075%20pounds,%20but%20the%20adult%20males%20are%20large%20and%20very%20aggressive,%20qualities%20that%20are%20key%20for%20defending%20their%20beach%20territories%20from%20rival%20males.%20Best%20of%20all%20are%20the%20fur%20seal%20pups,%20feisty,%20flappy%20and%20only%20the%20size%20of%20a%20small%20dog.%20It%20is%20an%20absolute%20joy%20watching%20them%20learn%20to%20swim%20as%20they%20jump%20and%20tumble%20over%20one%20another,%20a%20sight%20we%20come%20across%20often%20in%20South%20Georgia%20where%20you%20can%20find%20the%20world's%20largest%20population%20of%20Antarctic%20fur%20seals.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Michael%20S.%20Nolan%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/6-seals-to-spot-in-the-southern-ocean/antarctica-aa931.jpg Male%20Elephant%20Seals%20may%20not%20be%20the%20prettiest%20animals%20on%20this%20list,%20but%20they%20are%20definitely%20the%20biggest,%20weighing%20in%20at%20up%20to%208,000%20pounds!%20When%20we%20encounter%20them%20on%20the%20beaches%20of%20islands%20around%20Antarctica,%20they%20are%20usually%20quite%20sleepy%20and%20relaxed,%20so%20we%20can%20get%20quite%20close%20to%20them.%20%20But%20not%20too%20close!%20If%20something%20disturbs%20them,%20they%20can%20move%20with%20amazing%20power%20and%20speed.%20%20We%20see%20them%20when%20they%20have%20come%20ashore%20to%20breed,%20but%20they%20live%20most%20of%20their%20lives%20in%20a%20very%20different%20world.%20They%20are%20one%20of%20the%20deepest%20diving%20animals%20on%20the%20planet,%20regularly%20descending%20six%20thousand%20feet%20or%20more%20in%20pursuit%20of%20squid%20that%20are%20their%20prey.%20On%20the%20way%20down,%20they%20collapse%20their%20lungs%20and%20slowly%20sink%20into%20the%20dark%20depths%20while%20peacefully%20sleeping. %3Cp%3EThe%20largest%20seals%20on%20Earth,%20male%20elephant%20seals%20can%20reach%20up%20to%208,000%20pounds%20and%20legnths%20of%20more%20than%2020%20feet.%20When%20we%20encounter%20them%20on%20the%20beaches%20of%20islands%20around%20Antarctica%20and%20South%20Georgia%20they%20are%20usually%20quite%20sleepy%20and%20relaxed,%20so%20we%20can%20get%20a%20good%20look%20(as%20well%20as%20a%20good%20listen,%20these%20boisterous%20animals%20are%20known%20for%20their%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.instagram.com/reel/CsUnzfSOBB-/?igshid=MTc4MmM1YmI2Ng%253D%253D%22%3Erange%20of%20vocalizations%3C/a%3E).%20But%20it's%20important%20to%20keep%20our%20distance—if%20something%20disturbs%20them,%20they%20can%20move%20with%20amazing%20power%20and%20speed.%20Although%20we%20see%20them%20when%20they%20have%20come%20ashore%20to%20breed,%20they%20live%20most%20of%20their%20lives%20in%20a%20very%20different%20world.%20They%20are%20one%20of%20the%20deepest%20diving%20animals%20on%20the%20planet,%20regularly%20descending%20six%20thousand%20feet%20or%20more%20in%20pursuit%20of%20squid%20that%20are%20their%20prey.%20On%20the%20way%20down,%20they%20collapse%20their%20lungs%20and%20slowly%20sink%20into%20the%20dark%20depths%20while%20peacefully%20entering%20into%20a%20'sleep%20spiral.'%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20David%20Cothran%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E A%20Ross%20seal%20on%20pack%20ice%20in%20the%20Southern%20Ocean,%20East%20Antarctica %3Cp%3EThe%20recluses%20of%20the%20Antarctic,%20Ross%20seals%20are%20solitary%20animals%20whose%20lives%20are%20little%20known%20and%20very%20difficult%20to%20study.%20In%20fact,%20these%20residents%20of%20the%20vast%20areas%20of%20frozen%20ocean%20that%20surround%20the%20continent%20are%20among%20the%20least-known%20large%20mammals%20in%20the%20world.%20Relatively%20small%20seals,%20they%20are%20variable%20in%20color%20and%20appearance%20but%20often%20have%20beautiful%20silvery%20fur%20and%20elegant%20black%20streaks%20on%20their%20backs%20and%20chests.%20Their%20small,%20needle-like%20teeth%20probably%20indicate%20a%20diet%20of%20fish%20caught%20deep%20below%20the%20ice.%20Our%20%3Ca%20href=%22/itineraries/epic-antarctica%22%3EEpic%20Antarctica%20voyage%3C/a%3E,%20which%20ventures%20into%20the%20Ross%20Sea,%20gives%20guests%20the%20rare%20chance%20to%20search%20for%20these%20elusive%20seals.%20It's%20a%20special%20moment%20if%20one%20is%20spotted%20and%20a%20huge%20thrill,%20even%20for%20the%20most%20experienced%20Antarctic%20traveler. %3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EThere%20are%20more%20than%2058,200%20posts%20on%20Instagram%20for%20#babysloth.%20And%20it's%20not%20hard%20to%20see%20why.%20That%20happy%20turned-up%20smile,%20those%20sleepy%20little%20faces,%20the%20tiny%20curled%20toes.%20Baby%20sloths%20are%20natural%20antidepressants.%20But%20becoming%20a%20sloth%20is%20serious%20business.%20When%20it’s%20time%20to%20give%20birth,%20moms%20usually%20descend%20to%20the%20lower%20canopy%20branches%20and%20go%20into%20labor%20while%20hanging%20upside%20down!%20If%20the%20baby%20sloth%20falls,%20it%20won't%20fall%20too%20far%20and%20mom%20can%20climb%20down%20to%20retrieve%20her%20new%20arrival.%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Krista%20Rossow%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E .jpg Baby%20penguin%20reaches%20out%20for%20food%20from%20its%20mother %3Cp%3EThe%20only%20thing%20better%20than%20seeing%20penguins%20in%20Antarctica%20is%20seeing%20baby%20penguins!%20Gentoo,%20chinstrap,%20Adélie%20or%20emperor—it%20doesn't%20matter%20the%20species,%20penguin%20babies%20are%20the%20cutest%20little%20balls%20of%20fluff.%20If%20you're%20hoping%20to%20spot%20them%20in%20the%20ice,%20head%20south%20in%20December%20or%20January%20which%20is%20prime%20time%20for%20chicks.%20Whether%20they%20are%20waddling%20around,%20grabbing%20a%20meal%20from%20mom%20or%20dad,%20or%20peeping%20loudly%20for%20attention,%20it's%20all%20adorable%20overload.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Andrew%20Peacock%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EIf%20you're%20headed%20to%20the%20Galápagos%20Islands,%20get%20ready%20to%20fill%20your%20photo%20card%20to%20the%20max%20with%20pictures%20of%20baby%20sea%20lions.%20One%20look%20into%20those%20dark%20and%20watery%20eyes%20and%20you'll%20be%20powerless.%20These%20sweet%20little%20pinnepeds%20can%20be%20spotted%20ashore%20throughout%20the%20year%20and%20throughout%20the%20whole%20archipelago.%20While%20pupping%20season%20peaks%20in%20October,%20lucky%20guests%20may%20come%20across%20one%20being%20born%20at%20other%20times%20of%20year%20too—and%20if%20that%20happens%20our%20naturalists%20are%20always%20happy%20to%20stop%20and%20linger%20so%20you%20don't%20miss%20the%20miracle.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3E%3Cbr%20/%3EPhoto:%20Kyle%20Furey%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E %3Cp%3E%3Cstrong%20style=%22font-weight:%20bold;%22%3EWhere%20to%20spot%20them:%20%3C/strong%3ERoss%20Sea%20and%20Weddell%20Sea%20region,%20especially%20Snow%20Hill%20Island%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EAnyone%20who%20has%20seen%20%3Cem%3EMarch%20of%20the%20Penguins%3C/em%3E%20knows%20these%20emblematic%20penguins%20endure%20unimaginable%20obstacles%20to%20keep%20the%20species%20going.%20Unlike%20all%20other%20penguins,%20which%20nest%20on%20land,%20emperors%20make%20their%20colonies%20on%20the%20sea%20ice,%20likely%20never%20once%20stepping%20foot%20on%20land.%20Males%20lose%20almost%20half%20their%20body%20weight%20while%20incubating%20the%20eggs%20in%20a%20special%20brood%20pouch,%20so%20as%20soon%20as%20mom%20returns%20with%20food%20for%20the%20newly%20hatched%20babies,%20dad%20is%20off%20to%20the%20ocean%20to%20take%20his%20turn.%20These%20incredible%20swimmers%20dive%20deeper%20and%20longer%20than%20any%20other%20bird,%20up%20to%20700%20feet,%20and%20can%20stay%20underwater%20for%2018%20minutes%20as%20they%20hunt%20crustaceans,%20squid,%20and%20fish.%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3ESighting%20an%20emperor%20penguin%20on%20%3Ca%20href=%22/destinations/polar-regions/antarctica/itineraries/journey-to-antarctica-the-white-continent/overview/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%20rel=%22noopener%22%3Ean%20Antarctic%20expedition%3C/a%3E%20is%20one%20of%20the%20most%20thrilling%20events.%20Standing%20at%20nearly%20four%20feet%20tall%20and%20weighing%20up%20to%2099%20pounds,%20the%20largest%20of%20all%20penguin%20species%20is%20usually%20encountered%20alone%20or%20in%20very%20small%20groups%20on%20sea%20ice.%20While%20emperor%20penguins%20are%20closely%20related%20to%20king%20penguins%20and%20have%20a%20somewhat%20similar%20appearance,%20it’s%20much%20more%20massive%20for%20its%20size%20than%20the%20king.%20Look%20for%20that%20iconic%20penguin%20tuxedo%20and%20broad%20yellow%20patches%20on%20each%20side%20of%20the%20head.%20 %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/meet-the-elite-8-penguins-of-the-southern-ocean/penguins-adelie.jpg A%20group%20of%20Adelie%20penguins%20on%20shore %3Cp%3E%3Cstrong%20style=%22font-weight:%20bold;%22%3EWhere%20to%20spot:%3C/strong%3E%20Near%20the%20tip%20of%20the%20Antarctic%20Peninsula%20to%20the%20islands%20and%20mainland%20in%20the%20Ross%20Sea%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3EThis%20is%20the%20species%20most%20people%20think%20of%20when%20they%20env

ision%20a%20typical%20penguin—that%20classic%20little%20man%20in%20a%20tuxedo.%20Adélies%20are%20entirely%20black%20and%20white%20with%20a%20distinct%20white%20ring%20around%20the%20eye%20and%20no%20bright%20colorful%20markings.%20They%20are%20one%20of%20three%20species%20of%20brush-tailed%20(or%20pygoscelis)%20penguins%20along%20with%20the%20gentoo%20and%20the%20chinstrap,%20and%20as%20the%20name%20implies%20their%20tails%20have%20very%20stiff%20feathers%20which%20stick%20out%20like%20a%20brush.%20Adélies%20in%20particular%20have%20a%20relatively%20long%20tail%20compared%20to%20most%20other%20species.%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EDuring%20breeding%20season,%20huge%20colonies%20commonly%20form%20with%20sometimes%20hundreds%20of%20thousands%20of%20individuals.%20Both%20courting%20and%20breeding%20are%20brief—it’s%20one%20of%20the%20shortest%20of%20all%20other%20penguins—with%20a%20lot%20of%20flipper-waving%20and%20calls.%20Males%20also%20present%20females%20with%20pebbles%20as%20a%20token%20of%20affection.%20Their%20molting%20period,%20which%20occurs%20at%20the%20end%20of%20the%20breeding%20season,%20is%20as%20swift%20as%20the%20mating%20period.%20Colonies%20can%20evacuate%20and%20disappear%20seemingly%20overnight.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/meet-the-elite-8-penguins-of-the-southern-ocean/gentoo-penguins-on-a-nest.jpg Gentoo%20penguins%20sitting%20on%20a%20nest %3Cp%3E%3Cstrong%20style=%22font-weight:%20bold;%22%3EWhere%20to%20spot:%3C/strong%3E%20Northern%20Antarctic%20Peninsula%20and%20several%20subantarctic%20islands%20including%20South%20Georgia,%20the%20Falklands,%20the%20South%20Shetlands,%20and%20Macquarie%20Island%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EAlthough%20gentoos%20are%20the%20least%20common%20species%20on%20the%20Peninsula,%20their%20colonies%20are%20usually%20established%20in%20places%20that%20are%20easily%20accessible%20for%20Antarctic%20visitors.%20And%20they%20are%20just%20as%20easy%20to%20identify,%20even%20from%20a%20good%20distance,%20thanks%20to%20the%20white%20triangular%20patch%20above%20each%20eye%20and%20brilliant%20orange-red%20“lipstick”%20markings%20on%20their%20beak.%20Plus,%20there’s%20that%206-inch%20long%20prominent%20brush-tail.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EYou’ll%20also%20find%20these%20birds%20on%20many%20subantarctic%20islands%20and%20they%20seem%20equally%20happy%20nesting%20among%20exposed%20rocky%20outcrops%20in%20the%20snow%20as%20they%20are%20on%20a%20pebbly%20beach%20or%20grass%20tussocks.%20Gentoos%20build%20their%20nests%20with%20stones%20and%20males%20often%20woo%20females%20with%20carefully%20chosen%20pebbles%20they%20offer%20up%20as%20gifts.%20A%20very%20fun%20behavior%20to%20catch%20in%20person.%20All%20that%20flirting%20must%20do%20the%20trick%20because%20gentoo%20parents%20often%20form%20long-lasting%20bonds%20and%20are%20very%20nurturing%20once%20baby%20arrives.%20Watching%20gentoo%20antics%20on%20land%20is%20exciting%20but%20try%20to%20spot%20them%20in%20the%20water%20where%20you’ll%20see%20them%20truly%20shine.%20These%20guys%20can%20swim%20up%20to%2022%20miles%20per%20hour—faster%20than%20any%20other%20diving%20bird—and%20dive%20to%20depths%20of%20655%20feet.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/meet-the-elite-8-penguins-of-the-southern-ocean/penguin-chinstrap.jpg A%20chinstrap%20penguin%20carries%20a%20pebble%20in%20its%20beak %3Cp%3E%3Cstrong%20style=%22font-weight:%20bold;%22%3EWhere%20to%20spot:%3C/strong%3E%20This%20abundant%20species%20is%20found%20all%20over%20Antarctica%20and%20the%20subantarctic%20islands%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EThe%20third%20member%20of%20the%20brush-tails,%20chinstraps%20look%20similar%20to%20the%20Adélies%20in%20both%20markings%20and%20size%20except%20for%20that%20narrow%20black%20band%20(or%20strap)%20under%20the%20head%20which%20makes%20it%20look%20like%20it’s%20wearing%20a%20little%20black%20helmet.%20With%20roughly%207%20million%20pairs%20in%20the%20world,%20this%20is%20one%20of%20the%20most%20abundant%20species%20so%20chances%20are%20you’ll%20see%20a%20whole%20lot%20of%20them%20when%20you%20make%20landfall.%20And%20also%20like%20Adélies,%20the%20chinstraps%20tend%20to%20form%20huge%20colonies%20numbering%20in%20the%20hundreds%20of%20thousands%20or%20more.%20Mates%20give%20an%20incredible%20performance,%20aptly%20named%20the%20ecstatic%20display,%20when%20they%20are%20courting%20or%20exchanging%20places%20at%20their%20nests.%20They’re%20very%20social%20birds%20in%20general%20and%20have%20multiple%20forms%20of%20communication%20from%20bowing%20and%20preening%20to%20flipper%20and%20head%20waving%20and%20gesturing.%20But%20they’re%20also%20one%20of%20the%20most%20aggressive%20species%20of%20penguins%20and%20can%20get%20into%20some%20very%20heated%20showdowns%20over%20nesting%20space.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/meet-the-elite-8-penguins-of-the-southern-ocean/king-penguin-and-chick.jpg A%20king%20penguin%20with%20a%20fluffy%20brown%20juvenile %3Cp%3E%3Cstrong%20style=%22font-weight:%20bold;%22%3EWhere%20to%20spot:%3C/strong%3E%20Only%20on%20subantarctic%20islands.%20St.%20Andrews%20Bay%20on%20South%20Georgia%20has%20a%20significant%20rookery%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3ENothing%20can%20quite%20prepare%20you%20for%20the%20soul-stirring%20experience%20of%20coming%20ashore%20on%20South%20Georgia%20and%20seeing%20tens%20of%20thousands%20of%20stately%20king%20penguins%20all%20on%20a%20single%20beach.%20The%20most%20striking%20and%20brightly%20colored%20of%20the%20penguins,%20kings%20are%20second%20in%20size%20to%20the%20emperor%20and%20sport%20a%20beautiful%20yellow-orange%20throat%20patch,%20an%20orange,%20inverted%20teardrop-shaped%20marking%20on%20either%20side%20of%20their%20black%20heads,%20and%20long,%20curved%20elegant%20beaks.%20Since%20they%20form%20breeding%20colonies%20on%20subantarctic%20islands%20and%20not%20sea%20ice,%20king%20penguins%20can%20spread%20their%20breeding%20season%20over%20a%20much%20longer%20time,%20between%2014%20and%2016%20months.%20They%20also%20spend%20a%20much%20longer%20time%20raising%20and%20caring%20for%20their%20chicks.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3ELike%20emperors,%20kings%20do%20not%20build%20nests%20but%20incubate%20their%20egg%20on%20their%20feet,%20keeping%20it%20warm%20under%20a%20feathery%20fold%20of%20skin.%20Both%20parents%20take%20turns%20incubating%20for%20periods%20of%201%20to%202%20½%20weeks%20while%20the%20other%20goes%20off%20to%20hunt.%20Chicks%20have%20fluffy%20brown%20plumage%20until%20about%20a%20year%20old%20when%20they%20acquire%20their%20adult%20feathers%20and%20coloring.%20They%20look%20so%20different%20from%20their%20parents%20that%20juveniles%20were%20once%20thought%20to%20be%20a%20different%20species.%20And%20sailors%20christened%20them%20‘oakum%20boys.%20The%20brown%20plumage%20reminded%20them%20of%20the%20color%20of%20oakum%20used%20to%20caulk%20timbers%20on%20sailing%20ships.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/meet-the-elite-8-penguins-of-the-southern-ocean/penguins-rockhopper.jpg Three%20rockhopper%20penguins%20stand%20on%20a%20grassy%20knoll %3Cp%3E%3Cstrong%20style=%22font-weight:%20bold;%22%3EWhere%20to%20spot:%3C/strong%3E%20Subantarctic%20islands%20often%20on%20steep%20cliffs%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3ERockhoppers%20are%20one%20of%20the%20most%20fun%20penguins%20to%20watch%20as%20they%20hop%20among%20rocks%20and%20boulders,%20sometimes%20stumbling%20or%20even%20tumbling%20down.%20Standing%20less%20than%2024%20inches,%20rockhoppers%20are%20the%20smallest%20of%20the%20Southern%20Ocean%20penguins%20which%20adds%20to%20their%20cute%20allure.%20The%20distinct%20yellow%20plumes%20above%20their%20red%20eyes%20are%20also%20very%20endearing.%20These%20penguins%20are%20part%20of%20the%20crested%20group%20along%20with%20macaroni%20penguins%20(and%20several%20other%20species%20located%20in%20other%20regions)%20and%20they’re%20the%20most%20elaborately%20adorned%20of%20all%20penguins.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EThe%20rockhopper%20penguin%20typically%20nests%20on%20steep,%20rocky%20shorelines%20with%20direct%20access%20to%20the%20sea,%20although%20these%20preferred%20sites%20often%20involve%20a%20lengthy,%20difficult%20climb%20to%20reach.%20But%20this%20species%20is%20tenacious%20and%20patiently%20hop%20back%20and%20forth.%20You’ll%20often%20find%20their%20colonies%20nearby%20or%20mixed%20in%20with%20nesting%20albatrosses,%20another%20fascinating%20bird%20to%20observe.%3C/p%3E A%20group%20of%20macaroni%20penguins%20show%20off%20thier%20yellow%20plumes %3Cp%3E%3Cstrong%20style=%22font-weight:%20bold;%22%3EWhere%20to%20spot:%3C/strong%3E%20Close%20to%20the%20Antarctic%20Convergence%20Zone%20and%20subantarctic%20islands%20including%20Falklands,%20South%20Georgia%20and%20South%20Sandwich%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EAnother%20crested%20penguin,%20the%20macaroni%20is%20so%20named%20because%20it%20brought%20to%20mind%20the%20English%20dandies%20of%20the%2017%3Csup%3Eth%3C/sup%3E%20century%20who%20strutted%20around%20London%20in%20gaudily%20plumed%20hats%20and%20outrageous%20costumes.%20This%20scrappy%20little%20penguin%20looks%20very%20close%20to%20a%20rockhopper%20but%20its%20crest%20is%20gold%20in%20color%20and%20considerably%20thicker.%20Not%20only%20are%20macaronis%20the%20most%20common%20penguin%20in%20Antarctica,%20they%20are%20the%20most%20numerous%20species%20of%20all%20penguins%20with%20an%20estimated%20nine%20million%20pairs.%20However,%20since%20it%20typically%20nests%20along%20steep,%20rocky%20shorelines%20on%20isolated,%20storm-tossed%20islands%20it%20does%20make%20encounters%20with%20them%20much%20harder.%20Good%20news%20is%20individual%20pairs%20have%20an%20unusual%20habit%20of%20nesting%20within%20the%20colonies%20of%20other%20species,%20so%20it%20is%20likely%20a%20few%20will%20be%20sighted%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3E%3Cstrong%20style=%22font-weight:%20bold;%22%3EWhere%20to%20spot:%3C/strong%3E%20Falkland%20Islands%20and%20Tierra%20del%20Fuego%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EFerdinand%20Magellan,%20the%20famed%20Portuguese%20explorer,%20lends%20his%20name%20to%20these%20skittish%20penguins%20which%20his%20crew%20came%20across%20on%20their%20attempt%20to%20circumnavigate%20the%20world%20in%201520.%20Another%20more%20classic%20looking%20penguin%20they%20are%20all%20black%20and%20white,%20except%20for%20a%20small%20but%20noticeable%20region%20of%20pink%20flesh%20on%20the%20face%20that%20flushes%20red%20as%20they%20get%20excited%20or%20try%20to%20cool%20off%20on%20land.%20They%20also%20shed%20beak%20feathers,%20pant%20and%20stretch%20their%20flippers%20to%20catch%20a%20breeze%20and%20release%20excess%20heat.%20Additional%20distinguishing%20traits%20include%20two%20black%20bands%20that%20run%20across%20the%20top%20part%20of%20their%20white%20bellies%20and%20a%20stretch%20of%20white%20feathers%20swooping%20down%20from%20each%20eye%20and%20around%20the%20neck.%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EUnlike%20any%20of%20the%20other%20species%20listed%20here%20Magellanics%20nest%20underground%20in%20burrows.%20They%20typically%20mate%20for%20life%20and%20return%20year%20after%20year%20to%20the%20same%20nesting%20site%20from%20which%20they%20hatched.%20Once%20chicks%20reach%20a%20suitable%20size%20they%20vacate%20their%20little%20homes%20and%20(like%20most%20other%20juvenile%20penguins)%20form%20dense%20creches%20for%20protection%20near%20the%20closest%20beach%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-reasons-channel-islands/ci-2-fox.jpg %3Cp%3EIt’s%20no%20surprise%20why%20the%20Channel%20Islands%20have%20earned%20the%20nickname%20the%20“Galápagos%20of%20North%20America.”%20A%20staggering%20%3Ca%20href=%22/expedition-stories/stories/the-channel-islands-rare-nature-close-to-home%22%3E2,000%20species%20of%20plants%20and%20animals%3C/a%3E%20thrive%20within%20the%20vast%20national%20park,%20and%20since%20isolation%20led%20to%20unique%20adaptation,%20145%20of%20them%20exist%20nowhere%20else%20in%20the%20world.%20Keep%20a%20look%20out%20for%20many%20of%20those%20endemic%20creatures,%20like%20the%20island%20fox,%20the%20island%20deer%20mouse,%20the%20harvest%20mouse,%20and%20the%20spotted%20skunk,%20along%20with%20myriad%20other%20wildlife—from%20five%20different%20species%20of%20pinnipeds%20to%20a%20herd%20of%20bison%20(the%20rumored%20descendants%20of%2014%20brought%20over%20in%201929%20to%20film%20the%20Western%20movie,%20%3Cem%3EThe%3C/em%3E%20%3Cem%3EVanishing%20American)%3C/em%3E.%20The%20islands%20are%20a%20birder’s%20paradise%20too—grab%20your%20binoculars%20and%20checklist%20to%20search%20for%20some%20of%20the%20387%20recorded%20species.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-reasons-channel-islands/channel-islands-torey-santa-rosa-island-531.jpg %3Cp%3EOnly%20two%20naturally%20occurring%20groves%20of%20Torrey%20pine%20trees%20exist%20in%20the%20world—one%20on%20Santa%20Rosa%20Island%20and%20one%20back%20on%20the%20mainland%20at%20Torrey%20Pines%20State%20Reserve%20near%20La%20Jolla,%20California.%20You%20can%20hike%20out%20to%20the%20base%20of%20the%20grove—spotting%20several%20other%20rare%20plant%20species%20along%20the%20way—and%20stand%20among%20the%20last%20enduring%20members%20of%20a%20once%20widespread%20Pleistocene%20forest.%3Cem%3E%20Photo:%20David%20Vargas%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EEach%20summer,%2010%20percent%20of%20the%20global%20blue%20whale%20population%20convenes%20at%20Channel%20Islands%20National%20Park%20and%20Marine%20Sanctuary.%20The%20krill-rich%20waters%20are%20a%20siren%20song%20for%20these%20massive%20filter-feeders%20who%20take%20in%20up%20to%2040%20million%20of%20the%20tiny%20crustaceans%20a%20day%20during%20feeding%20season.%20Can’t%20make%20it%20there%20in%20summer?%20Not%20to%20worry.%20Blues%20can%20sometimes%20be%20spotted%20other%20times%20throughout%20the%20year,%20but%20the%20channel’s%20all-you-can-eat%20buffet%20draws%20plenty%20more%20marine%20life%20too.%20Depending%20on%20when%20you%20explore,%20look%20out%20for%2026%20other%20species%20of%20cetaceans,%20including%20gray,%20humpback,%20minke,%20sperm,%20and%20pilot%20whales;%20plus%20orcas,%20Pacific%20white-sided%20dolphins,%20Dall’s%20porpoises,%20and%20bottlenose%20dolphins.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-reasons-channel-islands/ci-excavation.jpg %3Cp%3EIn%201959,%20archaeologist%20Phil%20Orr%20unearthed%20two%20thighbones%20from%20the%20side%20of%20Arlington%20Canyon%20on%20Santa%20Rosa%20Island.%20While%20he%20knew%20it%20was%20a%20significant%20discovery%20dating%20back%20at%20least%2010,000%20years,%20it%20wasn’t%20until%20four%20decades%20later%20that%20more%20modern%20technology%20was%20able%20to%20confirm%20his%20hunch—the%20Arlington%20Springs%20Man,%20as%20Orr%20christened%20the%20remains,%20lived%20about%2013,000%20years%20ago,%20at%20

the%20end%20of%20the%20Pleistocene.%20At%20that%20time%20the%20sea%20level%20was%20a%20lot%20lower%20and%20what%20are%20now%20four%20separate%20islands%20were%20once%20all%20connected%20into%20one%20mega-island%20known%20as%20Santarosae.%20Since%20that%20island%20was%20never%20connected%20to%20the%20mainland,%20the%20evidence%20supports%20the%20notable%20idea%20that%20watercraft%20were%20in%20use%20along%20the%20California%20coast%20at%20that%20early%20date—and%20that%20the%20earliest%20peoples%20to%20enter%20the%20Western%20Hemisphere%20may%20have%20migrated%20along%20the%20Pacific%20coast%20from%20Siberia%20and%20Alaska%20on%20boats.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EAfter%20years%20of%20excavation,%20the%20Avenue%20of%20the%20Sphinxes%20is%20finally%20open%20to%20the%20public.%20Set%20on%20the%20east%20bank%20of%20the%20Nile%20River,%20this%20magnificent%20250-foot-wide%20promenade%20is%20lined%20with%20more%20than%201,300%20sphinx%20statues—some%20bearing%20ram’s%20heads.%20Construction%20first%20started%20during%20the%20reign%20of%20Queen%20Hatshepsut,%20and%20this%201.7-mile-long%20road,%20which%20connects%20Karnak%20Temple%20Complex%20to%20the%20Luxor%20Temple,%20would%20become%20an%20integral%20part%20of%20the%20Opet%20Festival.%20During%20the%20celebration%20ancient%20Egyptians%20paraded%20with%20statues%20of%20the%20gods,%20re-enacting%20the%20marriage%20of%20Amun%20and%20his%20wife,%20Mut,%20with%20a%20ritual%20procession%20from%20Karnak%20to%20Luxor.%20Restoration%20efforts%20also%20found%20Cleopatra’s%20royal%20seal%20(a%20cartouche),%20implying%20that%20the%20legendary%20Queen%20of%20the%20Ptolemaic%20Kingdom%20stopped%20by%20the%20temple%20during%20her%20Nile%20River%20journey%20with%20Marc%20Anthony. %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20David%20Vargas%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/exploring-egypt-5-must-see-sights-at-karnak-temple-complex/colonnade-of-amenhotep-iii.jpg %3Cp%3ESeven%20pairs%20of%2052-foot-high%20open-flower%20papyrus%20columns%20are%20the%20oldest%20segment%20of%20this%20temple,%20which%20was%20started%20during%20the%20reign%20of%20Amenhotep%20III%20in%20the%2018%3Csup%3Eth%3C/sup%3E%20Dynasty.%20Amehotep%20III%20appreciated%20splendor,%20and%20erected%20double%20statues%20of%20Amun%20and%20Mut%20on%20the%20south%20side,%20as%20well%20as%20those%20of%20himself%20and%20his%20wife.%20While%20the%20colonnade%20wasn’t%20complete%20under%20Amehotep’s%20watchful%20eye,%20the%20construction%20continued%20during%20the%20reign%20of%20Tutankhamun,%20Ay,%20and%20Horemheb.%20“It%20is%20one%20of%20the%20few%20places%20King%20Tut%20has%20made%20a%20significant%20contribution%20to,”%20says%20Bill%20Robison,%20director%20of%20Expedition%20Development%20Charter%20Ships%20for%20Lindblad%20Expeditions.%20The%20Colonnade%20was%20to%20serve%20as%20a%20processional%20entrance%20for%20musicians,%20dancers,%20and%20priests%20during%20the%20Opet%20Festival.%20Today,%20walking%20through%20the%2032-foot-wide%20space%20inspires%20awe,%20but%20it%20was%20truly%20sacred%20in%20its%20original%20form%20when%20the%20walls%20rose%20up%20to%20the%20roof,%20only%20allowing%20slits%20of%20sunlight%20to%20seep%20through%20clerestory%20windows.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/exploring-egypt-5-must-see-sights-at-karnak-temple-complex/luxor-temple-pylon-of-ramses-rlh.jpg %3Cp%3EUp%20until%20the%201880s,%20the%20grand%20gateway%20entrance%20at%20the%20end%20of%20the%20Avenue%20of%20the%20Sphinxes%20was%20half%20buried%20in%20sand.%20Today,%20two%20impressive%20King%20Ramses%20II%20statues%20greet%20visitors%20as%20they%20near%20the%20Luxor%20Temple,%20along%20with%20one%2082-foot%20obelisk%20carved%20with%20sunken%20reliefs%20of%20the%20battle%20of%20Kadesh.%20A%20second%203,300-year%20old%20obelisk%20no%20longer%20holds%20its%20post%20at%20Luxor,%20but%20instead%20stands%20in%20the%20Place%20de%20la%20Concorde%20in%20Paris.%20As%20Amun%20passed%20through%20this%20entrance,%20it's%20said%20that%20he%20transformed%20into%20Min,%20the%20god%20of%20fertility,%20making%20it%20a%20significant%20landmark%20in%20the%20complex.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Ralph%20Lee%20Hopkins%3Cspan%20class=%22Apple-converted-space%22%3E %3C/span%3E%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/exploring-egypt-5-must-see-sights-at-karnak-temple-complex/abbul-haggag-mosque-at-luxor.jpg %3Cp%3EBy%20the%2013%3Csup%3Eth%3C/sup%3E%20century,%20the%20mosque%20of%20Abu'l%20Haggag%20was%20erected%20in%20the%20court%20of%20Ramses%20II,%20surrounded%20by%20the%20ruins%20of%20earlier%20Christian%20basilicas.%20“It%20was%20built%20at%20ground%20level%20at%20the%20time,%20but%20now%20sits%20high%20above%20the%20ruins,”%20Robison%20says.%20“This%20is%20particularly%20interesting%20because%20it%20shows%20just%20how%20much%20of%20Luxor%20Temple%20was%20under%20the%20city.”%20The%20mosque%20is%20named%20after%20Youssef,%20a%20sheikh%20who%20was%20spreading%20the%20word%20of%20Islam%20and%20became%20known%20as%20The%20Father%20of%20Pilgrims%20(Abu%20Haggag).%20Whether%20he%20actually%20built%20the%20mosque%20is%20disputed,%20but%20legend%20has%20it%20that%20Youssef%20saved%20the%20mosque%20from%20demolition.%20As%20a%20currently%20functioning%20place%20of%20worship,%20it%20is%20a%20testament%20to%20the%20temple’s%20importance%20as%20a%20hub%20for%20continuous%20devotion%20for%20almost%2035%20centuries.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/exploring-egypt-5-must-see-sights-at-karnak-temple-complex/court-of-amenhotep.jpg %3Cp%3EOne%20of%20many%20accolades%20of%20Amenhotep%20III,%20who%20ruled%20Egypt%20for%20four%20decades,%20is%20his%20eponymous%20court%20which%20leads%20to%20the%20famous%20Hypostyle%20Hall.%20The%20court%20spans%20more%20than%20half%20an%20acre%20and%20is%20adorned%20with%20double%20rows%20of%2050-foot-high%20papyrus%20columns,%20once%20punctured%20by%20statues.%20Amenhotep%20himself%20called%20the%20white%20sandstone%20complex%20%22a%20fortress%20of%20eternity,”%20embellishing%20it%20with%20gold,%20silver%20floors%20and%20electrum%20(gold%20and%20silver%20alloy)%20doorways.%20Early-Ptolemaic-style%20reliefs%20were%20a%20mark%20of%20Alexander%20the%20Great.%20Between%20the%204th%20and%206th%20century%20CE,%20an%20apse%20was%20added%20to%20the%20vestibule%20celebrating%20Roman%20emperors,%20though%20the%20work%20is%20severely%20damaged.%20Earthquakes,%20Nile%20floods%20and%20looting%20led%20to%20the%20temple’s%20ruin—that%20is%20until%20archeologists%20started%20massive%20excavation%20and%20preservation%20efforts%20about%2020%20years%20ago%20to%20help%20return%20this%20important%20site%20to%20its%20former%20glory.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3EAfter%20Christian%20Fletcher%20and%20his%20followers%20aboard%20the%20British%20ship%20%3C/span%3E%3Cem%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3EHMS%20Bounty%3C/span%3E%3C/em%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3E%20overthrew%20the%20abusive%20Captain%20William%20Bligh%20in%201789,%20some%20settled%20in%20Tahiti%20and%20others%20on%20Pitcairn%20Island.%20In%201856,%20the%20descendants%20of%20the%20Pitcairn%20settlers%20outgrew%20the%20two-square-mile%20island,%20and%20196%20of%20them%20relocated%20to%20Norfolk%20Island.%20Today,%20half%20of%20Norfolk’s%202,000%20residents%20can%20trace%20their%20heritage%20to%20the%20mutineers%20and%20their%20Polynesian%20partners.%20There’s%20even%20a%20museum%20with%20%3C/span%3E%3Cem%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3EBounty%3C/span%3E%3C/em%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3E%20artifacts%20and%20the%20annual%20Bounty%20Day%20celebration%20marks%20the%20June%208%20arrival%20of%20the%20Pitcairn%20resettlers.%20Fun%20fact:%20Due%20to%20the%20shared%20heritage%20of%20many%20residents%20and%20their%20resulting%20shared%20last%20names,%20nicknames%20(e.g.,%20Biddy%20&%20Dids,%20Storky%20&%20Fishy)%20can%20be%20found%20in%20the%20telephone%20directory.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20A%20replica%20of%20the%20infamous%20%3C/em%3EHMS%20Bounty%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3EMore%20than%20166,000%20British%20citizens%20were%20condemned%20to%20convict%20colonies%20in%20Australia%20between%201787%20and%201868,%20and%20of%20the%20country’s%20thousands%20of%20penal%20colonies,%20none%20was%20as%20notorious%20as%20Norfolk’s.%20The%20island’s%20first%20penal%20colony%20was%20mostly%20agricultural;%20however,%20the%20one%20that%20followed%20from%201825-1855,%20housed%20repeat%20offenders%20and%20earned%20the%20epithet%20“Hell%20in%20the%20Pacific.”%20It%20was%20reported%20that%20criminals%20preferred%20the%20death%20sentence%20to%20incarceration%20on%20Norfolk%20due%20to%20its%20reputation%20for%20torture,%20hard%20labor%20in%20shackles,%20and%20poor%20living%20conditions.%20The%20250-acre%20site%20in%20Kingston%20is%20one%20of%2011%20Australian%20Convict%20Sites%20recognized%20by%20UNESCO%20and%20when%20you%20visit%20with%20Lindblad%20Expeditions-National%20Geographic,%20there%20will%20be%20opportunities%20to%20explore%20the%20area%20further%20on%20a%20Convict%20Heritage%20Tour,%20Bridal%20Track%20Coastal%20Walk,%20or%20by%20visiting%20the%20Museum%20World%20of%20Norfolk. %20%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3ENorfolk%20has%20two%20official%20languages:%20English%20and%20Norfuk,%20which%20is%20a%20blend%20of%201700s-era%20English%20and%20Tahitian.%20The%20original%20Bounty%20mutineers%20and%20their%20Tahitian%20consorts%20developed%20a%20creole%20language%20that%20is%20still%20used%20today%20by%20their%20descendants.%20There%20are%20noticeable%20links%20to%20Scots%20in%20pronunciation,%20and%20to%20Tahitian,%20as%20in%20the%20structure%20of%20words%20using%20reduplication%20like%20%3C/span%3E%3Cem%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3Ehoowi-hoowi,%3C/span%3E%3C/em%3E%3Cspan%20style=%22font-weight:%20400;%22%3E%20meaning%20“filthy.”%20“Gud%20mornen”%20is%20easily%20translated%20as%20“good%20morning,”%20but%20if%20a%20local%20asks%20“Watawieh%20yorlye?,”%20reply%20with%20“Fine,%20thank%20you,”%20as%20you%20are%20being%20asked%20“Hello,%20how%20are%20you%20all?”%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E ct%20advantage%20over%20any%20land-based%20camp—she%20moves,%20giving%20you%20an%20ever-varied%20experience%20of%20the%20Amazon’s%20multiple%20landscapes%20and%20wonders.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%20class=%22p1%22%3E%3Cspan%20class=%22s1%22%3E%3Cem%3ELord%20of%20the%20Glens%3C/em%3E%20is%20a%20spectacular%20ship.%20She%20was%20built%20for%20one%20purpose—to%20fit%20through%20the%20network%20of%20locks%20and%20canals%20that%20cut%20through%20the%20heart%20of%20the%20Scottish%20highlands.%20So,%20she%20is%20uniquely%20able%20to%20offer%20a%20voyage%20through%20the%20Caledonian%20Canal,%20which%20connects%20the%20North%20Sea%20to%20the%20Atlantic%20and%20goes%20through%20the%20very%20heart%20of%20the%20Scottish%20Highlands.%20Add%20to%20that%20her%20ability%20to%20navigate%20the%20coastline%20and%20venture%20to%20the%20islands%20of%20the%20Inner%20Hebrides%20and%20you%20have%20the%20basis%20for%20a%20striking%20expedition.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%20class=%22p2%22%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%20class=%22p1%22%3E%3Cspan%20class=%22s1%22%3ELife%20aboard%20%3Cem%3ELord%20of%20the%20Glens%3C/em%3E%20feels%20like%20a%20cross%20between%20relaxing%20in%20a%20stately%20country%20manor%20and%20taking%20a%20voyage%20aboard%20a%20private%20yacht%20with%20friends.%20It%20is%20the%20perfect%20way%20to%20explore%20the%20Scottish%20countryside.%20She%20is%20paneled%20in%20polished%20wood,%20with%20teak%20decks,%20offering%20gourmet%20cuisine,%20and%20exceptional%20personal%20service.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%20class=%22p2%22%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%20class=%22p1%22%3E%3Cspan%20class=%22s1%22%3E%3Cem%3ELord%20of%20the%20Glens%3C/em%3E%20is%20small%20enough%20to%20come%20alongside%20daily%20in%20charming%20locations%20and%20to%20moor%20overnight%20in%20small%20welcoming%20communities%20such%20as%20the%20fishing%20village%20of%20Inverie%20which,%20although%20on%20the%20Scottish%20mainland,%20has%20no%20access%20by%20road%20with%20any%20other%20community%20in%20Scotland.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EEdward%20and%20Susie%20Piegza,%20founders%20of%20Classic%20Journeys,%20describe%20the%20common%20ethos%20with%20National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions:%20“National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions%20is%20all%20about%20exploration%20as%20a%20means%20to%20elevate%20the%20soul%20to%20care%20about%20the%20planet%20and%20its%20people.%20It’s%20known%20for%20its%20small%20ships%20and%20expert%20guides.%20It%20is%20known%20for%20pioneering%20exploration%20across%20the%20globe,%20whether%20it%20be%20on%20small%20ships,%20on%20foot,%20or%20on%20bicycles,%20and%20their%20renowned%20teams%20of%20expert%20naturalists%20and%20guides.%20Equally,%20Classic%20Journeys%20believes%20in%20building%20cross-cultural%20connections,%20on%20foot%20and%20at%20eye%20level,%20one%20step%20and%20one%20person%20at%20a%20time.%20The%20first%20time%20we%20met%20Sven%20Lindblad%20he%20shared%20with%20us%20that%20everything%20National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions%20does%20needs%20to%20add%20value%20to%20the%20guest%20experience.%20That%20really%20resonated%20with%20us%20because%20our%20goal%20is%20to%20handcraft%20a%20trip%20of%20a%20lifetime,%20for%20every%20guest,%20on%20every%20tour.%20So%20we%20knew%20our%20companies%20had%20shared%20values.”%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EDuring%20the%20June%201944%20D-Day%20attacks%20that%20marked%20the%20beginning%20of%20the%20end%20of%20World%20War%20II,%20Omaha%20was%20one%20of%20two%20American%20landings—and%20it%20was%20the%20deadliest%20of%20the%20Allies’%20five.%20From%20the%20waters%20of%20the%20English%20Channel,%20the%20terrain%20makes%20for%20a%20clear%20target,%20with%20its%20crescent-shaped%20swath%20of%20sand%20flanked%20by%20imposing%20limestone%20cliffs.%20Renowned%20historian%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.expeditions.com/about/expedition-team/mark-bielski/%22%3EDr.%20Mark%20Bielski%3C/a%3E%20provides%20devastating%20context%20to%20memorials%20commemorating%20the%20thousands%20of%20soldiers%20who%20lost%20their%20lives.%20Reconciling%20the%20natural%20beauty%20of%20Omaha%20with%20this%20most%20brutal%20of%20battles%20is%20a%20difficult%20and%20deeply%20moving%20experience.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EThere’s%20a%20world%20of%20Technicolor%20fish%20to%20explore%20beneath%20the%20waterline,%20but%20a%20funny%20thing%20happens%20when%20you%20start%20to%20snorkel%20in%20spots%20such%20as%20Española%20Island’s%20Gardner%20Bay:%20The%20quiet%20swimming%20fish%20are%20suddenly%20interrupted%20by%20a%20zooming%20sea%20lion%20that%20seems%20to%20be%20speeding%20right%20at%20you.%20It%20spins%20and%20twirls,%20doing%20rapid%20figure%20eights%20to%20get%20your%20attention.%20And%20then,%20zip,%20it’s%20gone.%20Although%20you’ll%20spot%20sea%20lions%20on%20the%20white%20sand%20beaches%20sunning%20themselves,%20underwater,%20they’re%20often%20playful%20and%20love%20to%20show%20off%20and%20interact%20with%20snorkelers.%20Picture%20a%20puppy%20darting%20around%20the%20backyard,%20and%20you’ll%20get%20an%20idea%20of%20how%20energetic%20and%20spirited%20the%20joyful%20acrobatics%20of%20a%20Galápagos%20sea%20lion%20can%20be.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3E(photo%20by%20Michael%20Nolan)%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E
