%3Cp%3EOne%20of%20the%20most%20iconic%20animals%20of%20Galápagos,%20the%20giant%20tortoise%20can%20seem%20almost%20as%20fictional%20as%20the%20Loch%20Ness%20Monster.%20Weighing%20in%20at%20more%20than%20500%20pounds%20and%20often%20upwards%20of%20100%20years%20old,%20these%20prehistoric-looking%20creatures%20live%20in%20the%20lush,%20towering%20highlands%20of%20remote%20Santa%20Cruz%20Island.%20Not%20only%20are%20giant%20tortoises%20real,%20but%20you%20can%20see%20them%20close-up%20and%20even%20walk%20alongside%20them%20with%20naturalist%20guides.%20Even%20more%20remarkable:%20In%20the%20verdant%20mountain%20areas%20you%20won’t%20see%20just%20one%20or%20two%20of%20these%20massive%20creatures,%20the%20largest%20living%20species%20of%20tortoise%20in%20the%20world;%20it’s%20common%20to%20witness%20dozens%20of%20them%20lumbering%20through%20the%20trees,%20munching%20the%20grass%20and%20greenery,%20and%20relaxing%20in%20a%20refreshing%20mud%20bath%20just%20feet%20from%20where%20you%20stand.%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3E(photo%20by%20Ralph%20Lee%20Hopkins)%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-must-have-experiences-in-galapagos/marco-ricca-equador-line_322.jpg %3Cp%3EOne%20of%20the%20inevitable%20occurences%20exploring%20these%20islands%20that%20straddle%20the%20Equator%20is,%20well,%20crossing%20the%20Equator!%20Although%20there’s%20no%20bright%20line%20across%20the%20Pacific%20that%20you%20can%20observe,%20Lindblad’s%20nautical%20experts%20are%20intimately%20familiar%20with%20the%20hemispheric%20divide.%20When%20you’re%20exactly%20on%20the%20Equator,%20which%20runs%20right%20through%20the%20aptly%20named%20Vulcan%20Ecuador%20on%20Isabela%20island,%20the%20celebration%20begins!%20There%20are%20cocktails%20and%20champagne%20to%20toast%20the%20moment%20and%20a%20festive%20party%20on%20the%20ship’s%20deck.%20You%20may%20spot%20staff%20dressed%20as%20pirates,%20and%20even%20King%20Neptune%20has%20been%20known%20make%20an%20appearance%20to%20mark%20this%20special%20moment.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E%3Cem%3E(photo%20by%20Marco%20Ricca)%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-must-have-experiences-in-galapagos/emily-mount_gl793.jpg %3Cp%3EThough%20these%20islands%20may%20be%20remote%20and%20the%20only%20sounds%20the%20crashing%20of%20the%20waves,%20the%20local%20residents%20nonetheless%20dance!%20In%20an%20elaborate%20courtship%20ritual,%20the%20male%20bounces%20from%20one%20brightly%20colored%20turquoise%20foot%20to%20another,%20lifting%20them%20up%20in%20the%20air%20almost%20like%20the%20sand%20is%20too%20hot.%20This%20fancy%20footwork%20is%20accompanied%20by%20spreading%20his%20wings,%20craning%20his%20neck,%20and%20whistling%20and%20cackling.%20Who%20could%20resist%20moves%20like%20those?%20Not%20the%20female%20booby,%20who%20then%20walks%20around%20this%20skillful%20dancer%20checking%20him%20out.%20If%20she’s%20interested,%20she’ll%20join%20in%20the%20dance%20and%20start%20mimicking%20those%20smooth%20steps.%20If%20not,%20she’ll%20simply%20ignore%20the%20male%20and%20continue%20on%20her%20way.%20(In%20case%20you%20were%20wondering,%20the%20male%20is%20showing%20off%20his%20blue%20feet–the%20bluer%20the%20feet,%20the%20healthier%20the%20bird,%20and%20thus,%20a%20good%20potential%20mate.)%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3E(photo%20by%20Emily%20Mount)%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-must-have-experiences-in-galapagos/marco-ricca-endeavour_0482.jpg %3Cp%3EOur%20chefs%20are%20integral%20members%20of%20our%20expeditions,%20and%20although%20they%20craft%20myriad%20enticing%20dishes,%20one%20meal%20especially%20stands%20out%20on%20a%20Galápagos%20journey:%20The%20Ecuadorian%20lunch.%20It’s%20the%20“pride%20of%20our%20ship’s%20galley,”%20says%20naturalist%20Ixora%20Berdonces.%20“We%20love%20this%20moment%20because%20it%20is%20our%20opportunity%20to%20share%20our%20culture%20and%20food.”%20The%20fresh%20and%20delicious%20elements%20of%20this%20special%20feast%20come%20from%20both%20the%20highlands%20and%20the%20coast.%20The%20golden%20roast%20suckling%20pig%20from%20the%20island%20of%20Floreana%20is%20a%20highlight,%20as%20is%20the%20super%20fresh%20ceviche%20and%20wild-caught%20fish%20in%20coconut%20milk.%20Desserts%20are%20a%20must,%20including%20a%20decadent%20%3Cem%3Etres%20leches%3C/em%3E%20(three%20milks)%20cake.%20And%20all%20of%20these%20flavorful%20Ecuadorian%20specialties%20are%20created%20using%20sustainable%20produce,%20herbs,%20and%20condiments%20exclusively%20sourced%20from%20Galápagos.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3E(photo%20by%20Marco%20Ricca)%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E A%20Gal%C3%A1pagos%20penguin%20swims%20towards%20the%20camera %3Cp%3EAll%20of%20them%20were%20amazing%20because%20you%20could%20get%20close%20without%20disturbing%20the%20animals,%20but%20my%20favorite%20was%20snorkeling%20with%20a%20penguin%20that%20was%20as%20curious%20about%20all%20of%20us%20as%20we%20were%20about%20it.%20I%20spent%20several%20minutes%20following%20this%20one%20penguin%20as%20it%20swam%20around%20and%20between%20us,%20and%20then%20suddenly%20it%20turned%20and%20popped%20up%20right%20in%20front%20of%20me.%20In%20that%20moment,%20I%20felt%20like%20I%20was%20a%20welcome%20visitor%20in%20the%20natural%20habitat%20of%20these%20animals%20and%20not%20an%20invader,%20who%20despite%20the%20best%20of%20intentions,%20in%20other%20parts%20of%20the%20world%20ends%20up%20disturbing%20wildlife%20and%20driving%20them%20away.%20I%20saw%20species%20in%20the%20Galápagos%20that%20I%20probably%20will%20never%20see%20again.%20That’s%20memorable%20on%20its%20own,%20but%20it%20was%20the%20closeness%20that%20I%20will%20always%20remember,%20particularly%20that%20inquisitive%20little%20penguin. %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/galapagos-guest-photo-diary/jon-zickel-galapagos.jpg %3Cp%3EMy%20youngest%20son%20Jon,%20who%20is%2013,%20saw%20a%20guest%20jumping%20off%20the%20ship%20into%20the%20water%20in%20a%20promotional%20video.%20He%20immediately%20decided%20he%20wanted%20to%20do%20that,%20but%20when%20the%20time%20came%20to%20walk%20the%20plank,%20which%20is%20what%20basically%20you%20had%20to%20do%20to%20jump%20off,%20he%20was%20having%20second%20thoughts.%20The%20crowd%20gathering%20around%20was%20encouraging%20him,%20but%20he%20was%20still%20hesitant.%20Then%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.expeditions.com/about/expedition-team/emma-ridley/%22%3EEmma%20Ridley%3C/a%3E,%20one%20of%20the%20naturalists%20on%20board,%20hopped%20up%20and%20jumped%20in%20fully%20clothed.%20That%20did%20it!%20He%20was%20the%20next%20one%20in%20and%20several%20others%20followed,%20including%20me.%20That%20will%20always%20make%20me%20smile. %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/gala-guest-impressions-mike-zickel/lava-field-in-galapagos.jpg %3Cp%3EI%20was%20not%20expecting%20to%20walk%20across%20a%20relatively%20new%20lava%20field.%20The%20experience%20was%20otherworldly,%20but,%20of%20course,%20the%20environment%20is%20very%20much%20a%20part%20of%20our%20world,%20just%20a%20part%20I%20had%20never%20seen%20before.%20The%20landscape%20appeared%20desolate,%20but%20a%20closer%20look%20showed%20that%20life%20was%20breaking%20through.%20Several%20very%20specialized%20plant%20and%20animal%20species%20were%20finding%20a%20home%20in%20a%20lava%20field%20and%20thriving.%20The%20hike,%20the%20heat%20(we%20were%20walking%20on%20black%20glass),%20and%20discovering%20niche%20species%20was%20just%20one%20of%20several%20experiences%20that%20makes%20a%20trip%20to%20the%20Galápagos%20unique.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/gala-guest-impressions-mike-zickel/seafood-in-galapagos.jpg %3Cp%3EThe%20food%20was%20an%20unexpected%20and%20somewhat%20indulgent%20experience%20that%20I%20looked%20forward%20to%20at%20every%20mealtime.%20Always%20different%20and%20always%20excellent,%20I%20can’t%20count%20the%20number%20of%20dishes%20I%20tried%20for%20the%20very%20first%20time%20and%20loved.%20The%20ceviche%20sticks%20out%20in%20my%20memory.%20On%20the%20first%20day%20I%20might%20have%20declined%20a%20seafood%20soup%20served%20cold,%20but%20by%20the%20third%20day%20(after%20everything%20else%20I%20had%20tried%20was%20delicious),%20I%20made%20a%20point%20of%20never%20saying%20no.%20It%20was%20excellent,%20and%20although%20we’ve%20tried%20to%20reproduce%20it%20at%20home%20with%20some%20success,%20we%20have%20not%20yet%20matched%20the%20chef%20on%20the%20%3Cem%3ENational%20Geographic%20Islander. %3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EThe%20beloved%20namesake%20of%20New%20Zealanders%20actually%20behave%20more%20like%20an%20honorary%20mammal%20than%20a%20bird.%20All%20five%20endemic%20species%20are%20flightless%20and%20similar%20in%20appearance%20with%20strong%20legs,%20hair-like%20feathers,%20whiskers,%20and%20long%20curved%20beaks.%20Because%20they’re%20nocturnal,%20meeting%20one%20in%20the%20wild%20is%20a%20rare%20and%20coveted%20experience,%20though%20some%20day%20foraging%20has%20been%20observed%20on%20Stewart%20Island%20and%20certain%20locations%20in%20Fiordland.%20At%20night,%20listen%20for%20the%20telltale%20sniffing%20sounds%20as%20they%20probe%20the%20ground%20for%20a%20meal%20of%20worms%20and%20insects.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/new-zealand-birds/kakapo_2880x1920.jpg %3Cp%3EThe%20flightless,%20nocturnal%20k%C4%81k%C4%81p%C5%8D%20is%20an%20incredibly%20eccentric%20parrot,%20with%20its%20owl-like%20face%20and%20lek-mating%20behavior%20(males%20showing%20off%20in%20groups).%20They’re%20great%20hikers%20and%20climbers%20and%20can%20get%20quite%20large,%20weighing%20up%20to%20five%20pounds.%20Once%20widespread%20on%20the%20mainland,%20there%20are%20now%20only%20around%20200%20k%C4%81k%C4%81p%C5%8D%20remaining%20according%20to%20New%20Zealand’s%20Department%20of%20Conservation,%20but%20a%20large%20population%20has%20been%20transported%20to%20predator-free%20offshore%20islands%20in%20hopes%20of%20saving%20this%20treasured%20endemic%20species.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/new-zealand-birds/northern-royal-albatross_2880x1920.jpg %3Cp%3EThese%20friendly%20faced,%20flying%20giants%20are%20the%20epitome%20of%20a%20seabird.%20Buoyed%20by%20their%2010-foot%20wingspans,%20they%20can%20spend%20years%20soaring%20over%20open%20ocean,%20only%20returning%20to%20land%20to%20nest.%20At%20Taiaroa%20Head,%20the%20tip%20of%20the%20Otago%20Peninsula%20in%20Dunedin,%20windy%20conditions%20nearby%20lure%20the%20world’s%20only%20mainland%20breeding%20colony%20of%20royal%20albatross.%20Here,%20one%20can%20get%20close%20enough%20to%20comprehend%20the%20awe-inspiring%20enormity%20of%20these%20birds%20with%20a%20stunning%20backdrop%20of%20verdant%20hills%20and%20beautiful%20blue%20waters.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/new-zealand-birds/penguins/yellow-eyed-penguin_2880x1920.jpg %3Cp%3EA%20whopping%2013%20of%20the%2018%20penguin%20species%20on%20record%20can%20be%20found%20in%20New%20Zealand,%20and%20the%20South%20Island%20coast%20harbors%20three%20particularly%20exciting%20ones%20including%20the%20endemic%20yellow-eyed%20penguin%20(hoiho),%20which%20breeds%20at%20Pilots%20Beach%20on%20the%20Otago%20Peninsula.%20Distinguished%20by%20a%20band%20of%20pale%20yellow%20feathers%20around%20the%20eyes%20and%20neck,%20they’re%20often%20called%20the%20rarest%20penguin%20in%20the%20world.%20Lindblad%20naturalist%20Mike%20Greenfelder%20recalls%20they%20can%20be%20“quite%20easily%20frightened%20and%20so%20a%20close%20approach%20is%20only%20possible%20by%20walking%20in%20a%20series%20of%20trenches,%20cleverly%20dug%20into%20hillside.”%20These%20shores%20also%20provide%20nesting%20grounds%20for%20the%20adorable%20little%20penguin%20(koror%C4%81).%20Blue-gray%20in%20color%20and%20standing%20at%20just%2010%20inches%20tall,%20these%20tiny%20waddlers%20are%20endemic%20both%20here%20and%20in%20Australia.%20They%20are%20nocturnal%20on%20land,%20but%20are%20active%20hunters%20and%20commonly%20spotted%20off%20the%20mainland%20coasts.%20Another%20southwestern%20coastal%20breeder,%20the%20endemic%20Fiordland%20(tawaki)%20is%20the%20only%20crested%20penguin%20with%20little%20white%20stripes%20on%20their%20cheeks,%20often%20seen%20in%20Milford%20Sound%20and%20on%20Stewart%20Island.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EA%20UNESCO%20World%20Heritage%20site,%20New%20Zealand’s%20pristine%20subantarctic%20Islands%20provide%20vital%20breeding%20grounds%20f

or%20more%20than%2040%20species%20of%20seabirds,%20including%20a%20diversity%20of%20penguins.%20On%20the%20northernmost%20Snares%20Islands,%20the%20Snares%20crested%20penguin%20has%20established%20more%20than%20100%20colonies.%20The%20pale%20pink%20skin%20at%20the%20base%20of%20their%20chunky%20red%20bills%20sets%20them%20apart%20from%20similarly%20dressed%20species%20like%20the%20eastern%20rockhopper%20penguin,%20which%20breeds%20at%20Campbell,%20Auckland,%20and%20Antipodes%20Islands.%20True%20to%20their%20name,%20these%20small,%20tufted%20birds%20pack%20some%20impressive%20hops%20to%20help%20them%20navigate%20the%20rocky%20shorelines%20where%20they%20nest.%20But%20perhaps%20the%20most%20exciting%20encounter%20awaits%20in%20colonies%20of%20the%20commanding%20and%20curious%20king%20penguin,%20with%20their%20sleek%20black%20and%20white%20plumage%20and%20gold%20and%20peach%20head%20accents%20making%20a%20striking%20contrast%20to%20the%20fuzzy,%20brown%20juveniles.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3ECape%20Kidnappers,%20just%20outside%20of%20Napier,%20is%20home%20to%20the%20biggest%20and%20most%20accessible%20gannet%20colony%20in%20the%20world.%20Since%20the%201870s,%20these%20elegant%20seabirds—up%20to%2020,000%20of%20them!—have%20returned%20annually%20to%20breed.%20Among%20the%20bustling%20expanse%20of%20vibrant%20black,%20white,%20and%20yellow%20plumage,%20onlookers%20can%20witness%20bill-fencing%20courtship%20duets,%20bonded%20pairs%20sweetly%20preening,%20and%20come%20January,%20downy,%20newborn%20chicks.%20Greenfelder%20describes%20gannets,%20which%20are%20also%20frequently%20spotted%20at%20sea,%20as%20“tiny%20rocket%20ships.”%20They%20hover%20high%20above%20the%20water%20to%20scan%20for%20fish%20and%20then%20tuck%20their%20wings%20for%20a%20spectacular%20plunge.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EThe%20humpbacks%20here%20engage%20in%20cooperative%20bubble-net%20feeding—a%20fascinating%20behavior%20you%20can’t%20see%20anywhere%20else%20on%20Earth!%20Working%20together,%20a%20group%20of%20whales%20corral%20and%20trap%20fish%20in%20a%20fizzy%20net%20of%20bubbles%20before%20bursting%20to%20the%20surface,%20mouths%20agape,%20to%20scoop%20up%20their%20meal.%20Only%20about%2050%20or%2060%20whales%20in%20all%20of%20Southeast%20Alaska%20have%20been%20identified%20as%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.expeditions.com/expedition-stories/stories/video-southeast-alaska-amazing-whale-moments%22%3Ebubblenetters%3C/a%3E,%20so%20these%20whale%20encounters%20are%20nothing%20short%20of%20amazing—but%20thanks%20to%20local%20%3Ca%20href=%22/blog/andy-szabo-alaska-whale-foundation/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%20rel=%22noopener%22%3Ewhale%20researchers%3C/a%3E who%20join%20us%20aboard,%20things%20get%20even%20better.%20As%20you%20watch%20the%20show,%20these%20experts%20reveal%20eye-opening%20facts%20about%20the%20individual%20whales%20you're%20witnessing.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Brenda%20Tharp%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EPlus,%20more%20caribou%20than%20the%20entire%20state’s%20population.%20There’s%20a%20real%20reason%20%3Ca%20href=%22/destinations/north-america/alaska/itineraries/exploring-alaskas-coastal-wilderness/overview/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%20rel=%22noopener%22%3EAlaska%3C/a%3E%20is%20known%20as%20the%20“Last%20Frontier.”%20Only%20one%20third%20of%20the%20land%20is%20defined%20by%20cities%20or%20towns%20and%20the%20population%20density%20is%20the%20lowest%20in%20the%20country.%20That%20leaves%20a%20vast%20expanse%20of%20remote,%20undisturbed%20wilderness%20where%20wildlife%20roams%20free%20and%20far.%20In%20this%20verdant%20playground,%20you’ll%20find%20the%20world’s%20greatest%20concentration%20of%20bald%20eagles,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.expeditions.com/expedition-stories/stories/wild-personalities-sea-otter%22%3Erafts%20of%20sea%20otters%3C/a%3E,%20huge%20Steller%20sea%20lion%20colonies,%20Alaskan%20brown%20bears,%20orcas,%20humpbacks,%20seabirds,%20and%20much%20more.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Ralph%20Lee%20Hopkins%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EStretching%20500%20miles%20north%20to%20south,%20the%20Tongass%20National%20Forest%20accounts%20for%20nearly%20one-third%20of%20all%20the%20old-growth%20temperate%20rainforests%20left%20on%20Earth.%20Temperate%20forests%20are%20a%20unique%20and%20richly%20biodiverse%20habitat%20and%20the%20Tongass%20supports%20a%20wealth%20of%20incredible%20flora%20and%20fauna—from%20towering%20cedar,%20spruce,%20and%20hemlock%20trees%20to%20rivers%20teeming%20with%20all%20five%20species%20of%20Pacific%20salmon.%20Hiking%20through%20this%20swath%20of%20green%20engages%20all%20your%20senses%20and%20our%20eagle-eyed%20naturalists%20will%20make%20sure%20you%20absorb%20even%20the%20tiniest%20details—from%20carnivorous%20plants%20and%20colorful%20lichen%20to%20fuzzy%20caterpillars.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/expedition-stories/5-things-se-alaska/inline-2.jpg %3Cp%3EThat’s%20right!%20Dive%20below%20and%20you’ll%20find%20a%20forest%20that%20rivals%20the%20Tongass.%20Alaska%20is%20home%20to%20three%20types%20of%20kelp%20which%20forge%20dense%20and%20richly%20productive%20forests%20in%20the%20relatively%20shallow%20waters%20along%20the%20coast.%20Some%20kelp%20can%20reach%20150%20feet%20and%20grow%2018%20inches%20in%20one%20day—and%20this%20towering%20ecosystem%20provides%20food,%20protection,%20and%20spa

wning%20grounds%20for%20a%20staggering%20amount%20of%20life.%20On%20the%20surface,%20you'll%20see%20the%20sea%20otters%20who%20patrol%20these%20forests,%20but%20our%20undersea%20specialists%20will%20help%20reveal%20%3Ca%20href=%22/blog/exploring-alaskas-undersea-with-diver-kayvon-malek/%22%3Eall%20the%20other%20weird%20and%20wonderful%20creatures%3C/a%3E—urchins,%20sea%20stars,%20snails,%20nudibranch,%20octopus—that%20lie%20below.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E%3Cem%3EPhoto:%20Alyssa%20Adler%3C/em%3E%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EYou%20probably%20know%20Alaska%20has%20mountainous%20terrain,%20but%20what%20you%20may%20not%20realize%20is%20how%20truly%20impressive%20those%20peaks%20are.%20The%20tallest%20in%20both%20the%20U.S%20and%20North%20America,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.expeditions.com/extensions/denali-national-park-pre-voyage-extension%22%3EDenali%3C/a%3E%20reaches%20a%20sky-high%2020,310%20feet%20above%20sea%20level.%20It’s%20so%20massive%20it%20even%20generates%20its%20own%20weather.%20The%20next%20nine%20range%20from%2018,009%20to%2014,573%20feet.%20But%20you%20don’t%20need%20to%20be%20a%20world-class%20climber%20to%20enjoy%20the%20many%20majestic%20peaks%20that%20dominate%20the%20landscape.%20Just%20step%20out%20on%20the%20bow%20of%20the%20ship%20and%20take%20in%20the%20incredible%20scenery%20as%20you%20sail%20past%20snow-capped%20mountains%20rising%20above%20lush%20forests,%20icy%20glaciers%20and%20idyllic%20coves.%20For%20a%20more%20adventurous%20angle,%20hop%20on%20a%20flightseeing%20tour%20and%20take%20in%20an%20unforgettable%20birdseye%20view. %3C/p%3E Raja%20Ampat:%20Indonesia's%20Underwater%20Eden https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/stories/slideshows/raja-ampat/slide-2.jpg %3Cp%3ERaja%20Ampat%20sits%20smack%20in%20the%20middle%20of%20the%20Coral%20Triangle,%20an%20intricate%20marine%20area%20that%20encompasses%20the%20waters%20of%20Indonesia,%20Papua%20New%20Guinea,%20Malaysia,%20the%20Philippines,%20Timor%20Leste%20&%20the%20Solomon%20Islands.%20Seventy-six%20percent%20of%20the%20world’s%20coral%20species%20can%20be%20found%20in%20this%20remarkable%20region—and%20Raja%20Ampat%20is%20the%20center%20of%20the%20center%20of%20coral%20diversity%20with%20553%20species.%20As%20you%20probably%20guessed,%20all%20that%20coral%20supports%20an%20abundance%20of%20fascinating%20life.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/stories/slideshows/raja-ampat/slide-3.jpg %3Cp%3EDoubilet%20and%20Hayes%20vividly%20remember%20their%20first%20expedition%20together%20to%20Raja%20Ampat%20in%202005.%20“We%20did%20not%20see%20another%20boat%20other%20than%20wooden%20dugouts%20for%20the%20whole%20month%20we%20were%20there,”%20they%20recall.%20Since%20then,%20they%20have%20returned%20often%20to%20explore.%20“Collectively%20speaking,%20we%20have%20probably%20spent%20between%201-2%20years%20getting%20to%20know%20a%20few%20of%20her%20secrets.%20We%20savor%20each%20and%20every%20minute%20we%20get%20to%20work%20there,%20and%20we%20don’t%20say%20that%20lightly—every%20moment%20under%20the%20sea%20is%20a%20standout%20moment.”%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/stories/slideshows/raja-ampat/slide-4.jpg %3Cp%3EWhen%20you%20plunge%20into%20these%20turquoise%20waters%20prepare%20to%20be%20utterly%20amazed.%20There%20are%20over%201,500%20coral%20reef%20fish%20species,%20five%20of%20the%20world’s%20seven%20sea%20turtle%20species,%20and%20seven%20giant%20clam%20species—and%20that%20is%20only%20the%20beginning.%20“The%20seascape%20is%20a%20tapestry%20of%20habitat,”%20say%20Doubilet%20&%20Hayes.%20“Shallow%20corals%20patrolled%20by%20walking%20sharks,%20deep%20reefs%20awash%20in%20nutrients,%20blue%20water%20mangroves,%20mangroves%20with%20carpets%20of%20leather%20coral%20so%20thick%20you%20can’t%20see%20the%20bottom,%20limestone%20caves.%20And%20then%20there%20is%20the%20marine%20life—walls%20of%20fish%20on%20Cape%20Kri,%20carousels%20of%20manta%20rays,%20and%20clouds%20of%20chromis%20in%20Melissa’s%20Garden.”%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/stories/slideshows/raja-ampat/slide-5.jpg %3Cp%3EAlthough%20the%20couple%20hopes%20to%20encounter%20new%20creatures%20each%20time%20they%20dive,%20there%20are%20two%20species%20which%20they’re%20happy%20to%20see%20time%20and%20again.%20For%20Hayes,%20it’s%20the%20wobbegong%20shark.%20“They%20are%20a%20quirky%20shark%20designed%20to%20live%20on%20the%20seafloor%20and%20they%20often%20lay%20about%20on%20large%20table%20corals%20for%20hours%20at%20a%20time.%20They%20have%20a%20fringed%20mouth%20that%20attracts%20prey,%20but%20it%20also%20makes%20them%20look%20a%20bit%20like%20a%20giant%20tawny-colored%20bathmat,”%20she%20says.%20Doubilet’s%20favorites%20are%20the%20large%20schools%20of%20sweetlips%20that%20live%20on%20many%20reefs—they’re%20bright%20yellow%20with%20stripes%20and%20bubblegum-pink%20lips.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/stories/slideshows/raja-ampat/slide-6.jpg %3Cp%3EFor%20their%20most%20recent%20project,%20Doubilet%20&%20Hayes%20are%20documenting%20the%20reefs%20as%20part%20of%20a%20long-term%20story%20for%20National%20Geographic%20called%20Coral%20Through%20the%20Lens%20of%20Time.%20“Each%20time%20we%20visually%20document%20the%20reef,%20we're%20embedding%20geotag%20information%20into%20the%20images%20so%20we%20can%20return%20to%20exactly%20the%20same%20spot%20and%20observe%20a%20reef%20through%20time.”%20They%20are%20also%20looking%20forward%20to%20returning%20with%20Lindblad%20Expeditions%20and%20sharing%20moments%20in%20this%20special%20sea%20with%20guests.%20“Every%20expedition%20is%20a%20collaboration%20of%20the%20curious—curiosity%20about%20our%20planet,%20our%20place%20on%20it%20and%20understanding%20it%20better.%20We%20want%20guests%20to%20deeply%20connect%20with%20these%20unique%20corners%20and%20to%20learn%20why%20knowing%20them%20firsthand%20and%20protecting%20them%20is%20crucial.” %3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/stories/slideshows/raja-ampat/slide-7.jpg %3Cp%3E“This%20expedition%20offers%20a%20glimpse%20of%20one%20of%20the%20greatest%20ocean%20pulses%20of%20life%20on%20the%20planet.%20There%20are%20very%20few%20reef%20systems%20left%20that%20are%20not%20overdeveloped,%20ravaged%20by%20climate%20change%20or%20overfished,”%20say%20Doubilet%20&%20Hayes.%20“If%20you%20love%20the%20ocean,%20Raja%20Ampat%20is%20a%20must-see.%20We%20would%20not%20miss%20it%20for%20the%20world,%20and%20we%20do%20not%20want%20you%20to%20miss%20it%20either.

rn,%20cleaned-lined,%20with%20large%20expanses%20of%20glass%20to%20keep%20you%20connected%20to%20the%20extraordinary%20views,%20%3Cem%3ENational%20Geographic%20Venture%3C/em%3E%20enables%20you%20to%20see,%20do%20and%20experience%20the%20best%20of%20her%20geographies.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EBorn%20in%20the%20cold%20waters%20of%20Patagonia,%20%3Cem%3ENational%20Geographic%20Endeavour%20II%3C/em%3E%20was%20built%20for%20heavy%20seas.%20Now,%20permanently%20stationed%20in%20Galápagos,%20she%20comfortably%20sails%20the%20Equator.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EA%20floor-to-ceiling%20rebuild%20when%20she%20repositioned%20to%20the%20tropics%20meant%20she%20could%20be%20crafted%20to%20perfectly%20accommodate%20the%20National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions%20style%20of%20travel.%20Where%20she%20previously%20carried%20136%20passengers,%20she%20now%20accommodates%20just%2096%20guests%20in%2052%20thoughtfully%20appointed%20cabins.%20She%20is%20exceptionally%20nimble%20and%20maneuverable,%20with%20a%20shallow%20draft%20to%20get%20up%20close,%20great%20viewing%20from%20all%20public%20spaces,%20an%20expansive%20open-air%20observation%20deck,%20large%20windows%20in%20cabins%20and%20suites,%20and%20state-of-the-art%20tools%20for%20exploration%20including%20a%20glass-bottom%20boat,%20underwater%20cameras,%20video%20microscope,%20plus%20kayaks%20and%20stand-up%20paddleboards.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EShe%20replaced%20the%20beloved%20%3Cem%3ENational%20Geographic%20Endeavour%3C/em%3E,%20which%20donated%20much%20of%20her%20artwork%20and%20her%20great%20spirit%20of%20camaraderie.%20Guests%20have%20described%20being%20aboard%20%3Cem%3ENational%20Geographic%20%3C/em%3E%3Cem%3EEndeavour%20II%20%3C/em%3Eas%20feeling%20like%20a%20cross%20between%20a%20grand%20floating%20hotel%20and%20scientific%20research%20vessel.%20She%20is%20beyond%20comfortable,%20and%20welcoming%20to%20solos,%20groups,%20and%20kids%20of%20all%20ages,%20and%20equipped%20for%20the%20up-close%20and%20personal%20explorations%20that%20makes%20Galapagos%20the%20trip%20of%20a%20lifetime.%3C/p%3E National%20Geographic%20Explorer https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/fleet/national-geographic-explorer/imagetext_1272x848.jpg %3Cp%3EOriginally%20constructed%20for%20service%20along%20Norway’s%20coast%20as%20part%20of%20the%20famed%20Hurtigruten,%20or%20Coastal%20Express,%20she%20ferried%20passengers%20among%20the%20fjords%20of%20this%20iconic%20coast%20in%20conditions%20that%20could%20deteriorate%20into%20heavy%20seas%20in%20a%20matter%20of%20minutes.%20She%20had%20to%20be%20able%20to%20handle%20deep%20swells%20and%20towering%20waves—and%20have%20a%20high%20degree%20of%20maneuverability.%20Those%20traits,%20and%20an%20ideal%20size,%20made%20her%20a%20natural%20choice%20for%20addition%20to%20the%20National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions%20fleet. %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EThe%20plans%20to%20completely%20rebuild%20her%20drew%20on%2050%20years%20of%20pioneering%20expedition%20history%20and%20expertise.%20%3Cem%3ENational%20Geographic%3C/em%3E%20%3Cem%3EExplorer%3C/em%3E%20was%20equipped%20with%20an%20ice-strengthened%20hull%20and%20advanced%20navigation%20equipment%20for%20polar%20expeditions;%20a%20roster%20of%20tools%20for%20exploration;%20and%20a%20well-appointed%20interior%20with%20vast%20expanses%20of%20glass%20for%20an%20unprecedented%20connection%20to%20the%20environment.%20Her%20interior%20and%20exterior%20design%20embodied%20the%20National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions%20expedition%20ethos—the%20privilege%20of%20wildness%20and%20the%20luxury%20of%20comfort.%3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3E %3C/p%3E%0A%3Cp%3EFor%20many%20guests%20she%20remains%20their%20paradigm%20of%20an%20expedition%20ship.%20She%20is%20devoted%20to%20exploration—from%20her%20Welcoming%20Bridge,%20and%20the%20Chart%20Room%20below%20it%20where%20you%20can%20tuck%20in%20to%20warm%20up%20with%20a%20hot%20chocolate,%20to%20her%20high-perched%20Observation%20deck%20with%20its%20aqueous%20light%20and%20compelling%2024/7%20views.%20Even%20the%20art%20on%20the%20walls—from%20the%20Hurley%20prints%20of%20Shackleton’s%20expedition%20to%20the%20stunning%20National%20Geographic%20photos—%20tells%20an%20uber-narrative%20of%20globe-spanning%20travel%20and%20a%20dedication%20to%20curiosity%20and%20wonder.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3E%3Cspan%20data-contrast=%22auto%22%3EWhen%20Lars-Eric%20Lindblad%20led%20expeditions%20to%20Antarctica%20in%201966%20and%20the%20Galápagos%20in%201967,%20he%20made%20history%20as%20the%20first%20explorer%20to%20bring%20private%20citizens%20to%20these%20epic%20wildernesses.%20Regarded%20as%20the%20father%20of%20ecotourism,%20he%20saw%20travel%20as%20an%20incredible%20opportunity%20to%20expose%20people%20to%20the%20wonder%20of%20the%20world%20so%20that%20they%20might%20think%20differently%20about%20the%20planet%20and%20our%20role%20in%20protecting%20it.%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%20data-ccp-props=%22%7B"201341983":0,"335559740":276%7D%22%3E %3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/about/lex-staff---sven-lindblad-1.jpg %3Cp%3ESince%201979,%20Lars-Eric’s%20son,%20Sven%20Lindblad,%20has%20nurtured%20the%20family%20legacy,%20establishing%20today’s%20Lindblad%20Expeditions%20and%20expanding%20the%20transformative%20travel%20experiences%20his%20father%20conceived.%20Under%20his%20leadership,%20Lindblad%20Expeditions%20built%20the%20world’s%20most%20advanced%20fleet%20of%20expedition%20ships,%20pioneered%20voyages%20in%20places%20like%20Baja%20California%20and%20the%20High%20Arctic,%20and%20set%20the%20industry%20standards%20for%20responsible%20expedition%20travel.%3C/p%3E https://world.

expeditions.com/globalassets/about/antarctica-bellingshausen-sea-ant226-11.jpg %3Cp%3EThe%20launch%20of%20our%202004%20collaboration%20with%20National%20Geographic%20marked%20a%20new%20era%20in%20our%20explorations.%20Together,%20Lindblad%20Expeditions%20and%20National%20Geographic%20have%20built%20upon%20our%20shared%20legacy%20of%20discovery%20to%20provide%20guests%20with%20wholly%20unique%20experiences,%20including%20immersive%20programs%20for%20photographers,%20young%20explorers,%20and%20undersea%20enthusiasts,%20as%20well%20as%20incredible%20opportunities%20to%20explore%20alongside%20the%20National%20Geographic%20Experts%20who%20join%20select%20voyages.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/about/imagetext_926x618.jpg %3Cp%3ETo%20offer%20travelers%20more%20than%20100%20itineraries%20across%20all%20seven%20continents,%20National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions%20relies%20on%20its%20extraordinary%20fleet%20of%20expedition%20ships—the%20most%20advanced%20in%20the%20industry.%20These%20vessels%20are%20built%20small%20and%20nimble%20so%20you%20can%20venture%20deeper%20into%20remote%20places%20and%20quickly%20disembark%20to%20spend%20more%20time%20exploring.%20And,%20each%20is%20purposefully%20designed%20for%20your%20destination%20to%20connect%20you%20with%20your%20wild%20surroundings%20in%20a%20more%20meaningful%20way.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/itineraries/antarctica-and-patagonia_legendary-ice-and-epic-fjords/pant_itinerarydaybyday_backgroundimage_2880x2880.jpg %3Cp%3ELindblad%20Expeditions%20was%20founded%20on%20the%20belief%20that%20travel%20can%20be%20a%20transformative%20force%20for%20good—and%20now%20more%20than%20ever,%20we%20are%20intentional%20with%20our%20choices%20in%20the%20pursuit%20of%20planetary%20stewardship.%20Every%20decision%20made%20is%20with%20the%20well-being%20of%20our%20shared%20world%20in%20mind,%20from%20supporting%20research%20and%20conservation%20projects%20through%20the%20Lindblad%20Expeditions-National%20Geographic%20Fund%20to%20carbon%20neutrality%20initiatives%20and%20locally-sourced%20food.%20When%20you%20make%20the%20choice%20to%20travel%20with%20National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions,%20you%20are%20contributing%20to%20these%20efforts—and%20to%20tourism’s%20positive%20impact%20in%20helping%20safeguard%20the%20planet%20for%20future%20generations.%3C/p%3E https://world.expeditions.com/globalassets/landing/safe-exploration/large-rgb-lindblad-expeditions-antarctica-paradise-harbor-ant21-1426.jpg %3Cp%3EThe%20safety%20of%20guests%20and%20crew,%20the%20fleet%20and%20the%20delicate%20regions%20where%20we%20operate%20is%20of%20paramount%20importance.%20Since%20leading%20the%20first%20civilian%20expedition%20to%20Antarctica%20in%201966,%20Lindblad%20Expeditions%20has%20been%20at%20the%20forefront%20of%20defining%20safety%20protocols%20and%20the%20creation%20of%20programs%20and%20policies%20that%20protect%20this%20delicate%20region,%20developing%20tools%20and%20processes%20that%20make%20it%20safer%20for%20not%20just%20the%20fleet,%20but%20all%20operators.%3C/p%3E %3Cp%3EAt%20National%20Geographic-Lindblad%20Expeditions,%20we%20simply%20could%20not%20do%20our%20work%20without%20the%20diverse%20kaleidoscope%20of%20humanity%20that%20creates%20and%20delivers%20our%20remarkable%20offerings%20across%20the%20planet.%20As%20a%20Company%20that%20respects%20and%20celebrates%20the%20inherent%20diversity%20in%20the%20places%20we%20explore,%20we%20recognize%20the%20need%20to%20mirror%20that%20same%20diversity%20and%20all%20the%20interconnected%20perspectives%20within%20our%20organization.%20We%20are%20committed%20to%20building%20a%20community%20of%20different%20genders,%20races,%20ages,%20sexual%20orientations,%20chosen%20identities,%20and%20countries%20of%20origin%20where%20every%20person%20brings%20their%20whole%20self%20to%20work%20and%20whose%20skills,%20talents%20and%20abilities%20are%20valued.%20We%20believe%20we%20can%20explore%20farther%20and%20in%20a%20more%20meaningful%20way%20by%20actively%20creating%20a%20more%20diverse%20and%20inclusive%20organization%20where%20everyone%20feels%20that%20they%20belong.%3C/p%3E
